title: My Zipcar won't start, what should I do?
body: If you're in your Zipcar but are unable to start it, here are a few things to try: Make sure your foot is on the brake when turning the ignition or pressing the push-to-start button If the steering wheel is locked (you're unable to move it left or right), turn the wheel as far as you can to the right while trying to start the car Try unlocking the car again (even if you're inside it) using your iPhone ® or Android ™ mobile app or by tapping your Zipcard on the card reader If the car has a push-to-start ignition and the key is accessible, ensure it is within close proximity to the steering wheel when pushing the ignition button Confirm your booking time has not elapsed (if it has, you may need to create another booking or call in for assistance)

title: Can I begin my Zipcar trip early?
body: If there is no booking right before your trip, you can take the car up to 14-minutes early at no additional charge. If the car is not available, or if the prior ride has not yet ended, you will not be able to begin your trip early and will need to wait until the start time of your booking.

title: What can I do if my car is dirty, damaged, needs maintenance, or has low fuel at the start of the trip?
body: Before you begin your trip, we ask that you take a moment to inspect your Zipcar inside and out and report any problems. This will help ensure our vehicles get the care they need, and you are not held responsible for any issues. If you find your car is not in the condition you expected, let us know. That might include: Damage, including scratches or dents larger than a credit card Fuel left below ¼ tank Dirty vehicles, including litter, smoke, pet hair, and more Missing fuel cards or parking passes Warning lights, flat tires, and other maintenance issues To make a pre-ride condition report: Open the Zipcar iPhone ® or Android ™ app Go to the Drive screen Click Report and submit a record of the issue(s) Keep In Mind If your car is not in drivable condition or is unacceptable to you, give us a call and we will work to find you a more suitable vehicle

title: Where can I find my Zipcar's keys?
body: The location of the keys might depend on the car and the type of ignition it has. For push-to-start vehicles, the keys are typically hidden within the vehicle. Don't worry, that's OK. Because the keys should remain within the car throughout your trip, you shouldn't need access to the car's key to turn on and off the vehicle. For cars with a more traditional bladed key , the keys will typically be tethered to the steering column of the vehicle. If you don't see them, check the cup holder, glove compartment, and side door compartments in case the last driver placed them there. If you cannot find the keys anywhere inside of the vehicle, give us a call for further assistance.

title: Am I able to receive a Zipcard or a replacement?
body: If you would like to receive a new or replacement Zipcard, please complete the following steps: Sign in to your Zipcar account Submit a request for a Zipcard Keep In Mind All US Zipcars can be locked & unlocked via the Zipcar iPhone ® and Android ™ app and a Zipcard is not required Be sure the mailing address on your account is up-to-date We'll replace or provide up to 1 Zipcard per year at no charge (additional cards are subject to $15 replacement fee)

title: The fuel card is missing from my Zipcar, what should I do?
body: If the fuel card is missing, let us know. From the Zipcar iPhone ® or Android ™ app, open the Drive screen and select Report to notify us of vehicle issues. If you can, please pay for fuel on your own and submit your receipts to be reimbursed . Keep In Mind Fuel cards are located in the driver's side visor

title: How do I edit or extend my Zipcar booking
body: To edit your Zipcar booking use the Zipcar mobile app on iPhone ® or Android ™ devices. Booking modifications can be made before or during your trip. Once your trip has ended, bookings can no longer be modified. Extend Your Trip During an Active Reservation Quick Extend (Up to 2 Hours) If your trip is already in progress, you can extend it directly in the Zipcar app. Open the Zipcar app. Navigate to the Drive tab. Tap Extend. Select an available extension time slot (Unavailable times are greyed out). Tap Confirm and Pay to complete the extension. Extend for More Than 2 Hours On the Zipcar app, navigate to the Drive tab. Tap Extend to open the extend screen. On the Extend screen, tap View Full Availability. You will be redirected to the Edit trip page, tap Edit trip. Select Drop-Off Time to open the time selection wheel (Unavailable times are greyed out). The new cost of your reservation will be shown on the update button, tap Update to save your changes. Modify Your Reservation (Before or During Your Trip) Use these steps to edit a trip before it starts, shorten a trip, or make longer extensions. Go to the Trips tab and select View Details under your active or upcoming trip. Once on the trip screen, tap Edit Trip to make changes. Select Drop-Off Time to open the time selection wheel (Unavailable times are greyed out). The new cost of your reservation will be shown on the update button, tap Update to save your changes. Keep In Mind If the car appears unavailable, it means you cannot book that time frame, and the car must be returned by your scheduled reservation end time. If you have text alerts enabled in your notification settings, you can extend your trip by replying to us via SMS

title: What can I do if I'm running late but unable to extend my trip?
body: If you're running late and are unable to extend your trip, it is likely because the car is unavailable for the timeframe following your trip. Call us at 866-4ZIPCAR as soon as you realize you will not be returning on time and are unable to extend so we can assist Keep In Mind Note that returning late can result in a fee .

title: Is a toll pass included in my Zipcar?
body: No, toll passes are not included in Zipcars. Zipcars use the pay-per-plate method. When you use a toll lane, the car will incur the toll based on its license plate, and this amount will be charged to your Zipcar invoice using the pay-per-plate method. Keep In Mind Do not use a personal toll pass as this may result in double-charging by the toll authority, and Zipcar is unable to remove toll charges incurred during a reservation

title: How is my booking billed?
body: When creating a new booking, you'll be able to select your desired payment method at checkout. A hold will initially be placed on the chosen payment method for the cost of the trip. After a short period, the charge will be directly applied to your account. If there are any promotions, discounts, and driving credit available on the account, it will automatically be applied at the time of booking. If backup payments are enabled on your account and your default card declines the charge, the next payment method on your account will be charged for any outstanding amounts. Additional mileage costs, toll charges, and traffic violations will be added to the trip charges once they are received and processed by Zipcar. It is common for these charges to appear several weeks after the trip. Keep In Mind If you book with Google or Apple Pay, any additional charges incurred after the initial booking will be billed to your default card on file.

title: What is driving credit and how does it work?
body: Driving credit is credit that can be applied to the cost of a future trip. Driving credit may be automatically applied to your account per your rate plan, applied following a poor experience with the service, or redeemed as part of a promotion. Here are some things to know about driving credit: Driving credit is non-transferrable Driving credit will be available and usable by all drivers on your account It is not possible to apply driving credit to a specific trip, it will always be applied to the next booking created Driving credit cannot be applied to ongoing or past trips Driving credit only covers booking costs, and does not cover fees, violations, tolls, & other non-trip charges Credit is available in the currency of the member’s primary driving country, and cannot be applied to reservations in places with a different currency Driving credit expires after a period of time (you can view the expiration of credit on your billing page) Driving credit is applied to the cost of your trip before taxes are calculated

title: Is there a damage fee if I damage a Zipcar vehicle?
body: If you happen to be involved in an incident with your Zipcar, a damage fee of up to $2,500 may apply. A damage fee can apply to dents, scratches, collisions, flat tires, windshield cracks, dead batteries, engine problems, vandalism, or theft of a Zipcar. Members are not responsible for normal wear-and-tear on the vehicle. However, the fee does apply to damage to a Zipcar vehicle caused by unavoidable events such as floods, hail, wind, trees falling, etc. Before each trip, we ask you to check the car inside and out and report any damage. This ensures that you will not be held responsible for damage that may have happened before your reservation. Damage protection plans can be purchased to reduce or eliminate your financial responsibility for damages to the Zipcar vehicle, in some circumstances.

title: Does my credit card rental car insurance coverage apply to Zipcar?
body: Some credit cards include rental car insurance . Zipcars may fall under this coverage depending on your credit card provider. To confirm, contact your credit card provider to confirm Zipcar is included in their rental coverage, and to what extent. If your credit card provider does offer applicable coverage, be sure to use it to pay for your booking. You can find more information on updating your payment information here .

title: How do I change the damage protection coverage for drivers on my account?
body: As an admin of a family account, you can manage your damage protection coverage, as well as the coverage plans of any drivers on your account by following the below steps: Sign in to your Zipcar account Click on My Account at the top of the page and select Account Settings Select the People tab Click the overflow menu (3 vertical dots) next to the driver you would like to update Select Update protection Choose the damage protection coverage that you prefer and select Update protection Repeat the above steps for each driver, including yourself, that you would like to update the damage protection coverage for. Keep In Mind Only admins of a family account can update damage protection coverage

title: Am I eligible to join Zipcar?
body: To join Zipcar's membership program, certain eligibility requirements must be met. Before applying, review the below requirements to be considered for membership in our car-sharing community. Driving License Requirements: Licenses must be valid, unexpired, and government-issued Licenses without photographs of the driver may warrant the request for additional legal identity documents Instructional permits, learner's permits and paper licenses are not accepted, including international licenses of these types Licenses which require supplementary documents for validity are not accepted Photocopied, digital, and temporary licenses are not accepted Canadian G1 licenses are not accepted Non-US licenses may warrant the request of additional legal identity documents Age Requirements: Applicants joining a consumer (family) or business account must be 21+ years old (or 18+ if residing in New York, Michigan, or Maryland) Applicants joining a university account must be 18+ years old Driving History Requirements: Incidents and violations may be grounds for rejection from membership Applicants in Michigan under the age of 21 must have no major violations or incidents, including excessive speeding, operating to endanger, reckless driving, leaving the scene of an accident involving property damage, operating a motor vehicle with a suspended or revoked license, and speeding in a school zone (or similar events) Applicants will be required to accept the terms and conditions of the member application and member agreement. Note Meeting the above requirements does not guarantee access to Zipcar's membership program. Membership may be denied or terminated at Zipcar’s sole discretion.

title: How do I book a Zipcar?
body: Booking a Zipcar is a breeze and can be done from the web or from the Zipcar app on iPhone ® or Android ™. Sign in to your Zipcar account From the Book a car page, input your search criteria Hit Search Select the car that meets your needs Drive worry-free by purchasing insurance (optional) Click Book this car Tips You can filter the type of vehicle & model when viewing the search results If you want to include unavailable cars in your search results, select My time is flexible on the results page

title: How do violations & citations work with Zipcar?
body: Members are responsible for legal infractions such as traffic violations and parking citations. If Zipcar receives notice of a violation during (or in some cases, following) your trip, you will be charged a $30 processing fee in addition to the original cost of the ticket. How do I pay for it? If Zipcar has already paid the citation, you will receive a charge to your credit card for the cost of the ticket (plus a processing fee), which will be available for review on the billing page . If Zipcar has not yet paid the citation (typically in cases where a physical citation is left on the vehicle for you), you will be responsible for settling the ticket with the issuing municipality directly. Please follow their payment options accordingly. While you are not the owner of the vehicle and the ticket may not be in your name, you will still be responsible for the ticket. What if I don't pay it? If you do not pay a ticket, we will be notified and charge you a $30 processing fee. Additionally, you are responsible for the cost of the ticket including any late fees and we will bill the total to your account. Other fines or membership suspension can also occur if the ticket is not paid on time. Can I dispute it? If you wish to contest a violation and the issuing municipality allows it, please do so promptly. If we receive a notice in the mail and you have yet to dispute the ticket with the issuing municipality, we will automatically bill your account for the amount of the violation, plus the processing fee. Keep In Mind In most cases, once Zipcar has paid the citation and charged your account, the timeframe to raise a dispute with the issuing municipality has expired or is otherwise no longer an available option

title: How do I update my payment method on my wallet?
body: Add a payment method Mobile: Go to the Account tab at the bottom right of your Zipcar Mobile App Click on the Wallet tab in your Account Settings Under payment methods, select Add a Payment Method Enter your card information on the next screen Select Confirm Payment to add your card. Website: Go to the My Account tab at the top right of the website Click on the Wallet tab Next to payment methods, select Add a Payment Method Enter your card information on the next screen Select Confirm Payment to add your card. Remove a payment method Mobile: Go to the Account tab at the bottom right of your Zipcar Mobile App Click on the Wallet tab in your Account Settings Please select the payment method you want to remove. Note: You must have at least one payment method on file as your default Once the next screen pops up, select Remove Confirm you want to remove this payment method by selecting Remove again Website: Go to the My Account tab at the top right of the website Click on the Wallet tab Select the overflow menu on the payment method you would like to remove Choose Remove and you should see the payment method updated as the default in your wallet Keep In Mind If you have backup payments enabled, you agree to let Zipcar charge your alternative payment methods if a payment fails. More information on backup payments can be found here You may add up to 10 payment methods to your wallet You can manage your payment methods by going to the Zipcar Mobile App or by visiting your account settings on the Zipcar Website Refunds for trip or membership charges can only be returned to the card originally used for the purchase Only admins and owners of an account can update the payment information Accepted forms of payment in the US are credit and debit cards Accepted forms of payment in Canada are credit and Visa debit cards

title: What is the basic insurance coverage Zipcar provides?
body: Members who comply with the membership contract are covered by Zipcar physical damage insurance on the Zipcar vehicle while driving a Zipcar. In the case of an incident, members are responsible for a damage fee of up to the first $2,500 of damage to the Zipcar vehicle, and all further Zipcar vehicle damage is covered by Zipcar insurance. The damage fee can be reduced or eliminated with the purchase of optional damage protection coverage . Zipcar insurance also includes secondary third-party liability coverage and, where required, Personal Injury Protection (PIP) or "no-fault" coverage. All third-party liability and PIP coverage meets the minimum requirements of the state or jurisdiction in which an accident occurs, and coverage is only available after a member has exhausted any other applicable coverage. To see the details of your third-party liability coverage, please read the "Third Party Liability" section of the Zipcar membership contract . Keep In Mind Coverage may be provided under a certificate of self-insurance, insurance policy, or both Members who joined Zipcar on a plan affiliated with a business, university, or other entity may have different insurance coverage than what is described above For accident claims in Canada, members who comply with the membership contract will be protected against liability for causing bodily injury or death to others, or damaging the property of someone other than the driver and/or renter up to the minimum financial responsibility limits required by the laws of the jurisdiction in which the accident occurs, plus provincial minimum levels for other statutorily required coverages, and are subject to all its terms, conditions, and exclusions. Except where required by law to be primary, any protection provided by us shall be secondary to, and not in excess of, any applicable insurance available to you, or any other driver.

title: Where should I park my Zipcar at the end of my trip?
body: Zipcar is a roundtrip service. Your Zipcar should always be returned to the home location the vehicle belongs to (this is where you picked the vehicle up from unless otherwise advised) at the end of your trip. If you're dropping off at a location that has more than one Zipcar space, any of them will do.

title: How do I end my Zipcar trip?
body: Once you're done with your trip, you can end your booking to make the car available to be booked by others. Before you do that, here are some things to keep in mind: Make sure the car has at least 1/4 tank of gas Clean out the car - it should be as clean as (or cleaner than) you found it Return the car to the home location it belongs to (if the location has more than one Zipcar spot, any will do) Make sure the ignition is off and the keys are removed from the ignition cylinder Close all the doors Lock the car using your Zipcard or iPhone ® or Android ™ mobile app Take End-Trip pictures to let us know you left the car in the same condition as when your trip started To end your Zipcar trip, follow the steps below: Open your Zipcar iPhone ® or Android ™ mobile app Click Drive from the menu Select End Trip Follow prompts and take pictures Keep In Mind Unused time is not refundable If you don't manually end your trip, it will end automatically

title: Am I able to return my Zipcar early?
body: Yes, you are always welcome to return your Zipcar and end your trip early. Ending your trip will make the car available to be booked by others. Learn more about ending your trip here . Keep In Mind Unused time is not refundable

title: Is mileage included with my Zipcar trip?
body: Yes, in most cases, some mileage is included with your Zipcar trip. There's never a limit on how far you can drive your Zipcar, but there is a limit on how many of those miles are included with your reservation. U.S. Mileage: Lite: 50 free miles per 24 hours, plus 20 extra miles for each additional hour (up to 50 miles/day). Standard: 200 free miles per 24 hours, plus 20 extra miles for each additional hour (up to 200 miles/day). Plus: 300 free miles per 24 hours, plus 20 extra miles for each additional hour (up to 300 miles/day). Canada Mileage: Lite: 50 free kilometers per 24 hours, plus 20 extra kilometers for each additional hour (up to 50 km/day). Standard: 200 free kilometers per 24 hours, plus 20 extra kilometers for each additional hour (up to 200 km/day). Plus: 300 free kilometers per 24 hours, plus 20 extra kilometers for each additional hour (up to 300 km/day). Additional Mileage Charges: Any mileage over the included amount is billed at $0.67 per mile (U.S.) or $0.67 per kilometer (Canada). Keep In Mind Your mileage isn't limited per day if you book for multiple days. So, if you have 400 included miles, you can drive as many miles as you'd like anytime during your booking. At the end, if your total mileage is greater than your included miles you'll be charged the above rates per mile. University plans include 180 miles (U.S.) or 180 kilometers (Canada) per 24-hour period. Some pay-per-mile cars and membership plans may include varying miles with each reservation.

title: Are there any fees if I cancel or shorten my booking?
body: As long as any changes to your trip are made with enough advance notice, no additional charges or fees will be applied, and you will receive a refund for the change or cancellation. To ensure you receive the full refund amount, be sure to modify your booking within the following timeframes: Within 30 minutes of creating a trip Up to 3 hours before the start time (for trips less than 8 hours in length) At least 24 hours in advance (for trips 8 hours or greater in length) Cancellations or shortened bookings made outside of the above timeframes will be ineligible for a refund. Keep In Mind If you need to modify your booking, rates are honored for 1 month before and after your original trip Early returns cannot be credited for time unused You can extend your ongoing trip if no existing trips immediately following yours

title: What are the various fees & charges I might incur?
body: In addition to the cost of Zipcar membership and standard driving rates , other fees and charges may apply. See below for details. Application Fee A one-time $25 application fee is applied when a driver applies for membership. This fee offsets costs for pulling driving records and reviewing and approving applications. The application fee is non-refundable and is charged whether or not the driver is approved for membership. Booking Change or Cancellation Fee There is no charge if you cancel or shorten your reservation with the required advance notice, but if you don't cancel or shorten within the required timeframe, you're responsible for the full amount of the reservation. The required notice is located on your reservation confirmation. Learn more about changing and cancelling a reservation . Business Account Setup Fee A one-time $75 account setup fee is applied when creating a business account. This fee offsets costs for account setup. The account setup fee is non-refundable. Specific membership plans and promotions may waive the account setup fee. Cleaning & Other Violation Fees General Cleanliness Fee: $50 per violation, plus costs incurred by Zipcar anytime a visit to the vehicle is required (examples include: trash left in car or pet hair). Smoking Cleanliness Fee: $150 per violation. Damage Fee Up to $2,500 to cover the costs related to an accident. Key Replacement Fee The cost of the replacement key if you lose the key. Late Return Fee $50 per hour (up to a maximum of $150), plus the extra time you used the car. Low Fuel Fee $30 if you return a vehicle with less than 1/4 tank of gas. Market/Regional Fees & Taxes Depending on where you live, local fees and taxes may also be applied to the cost of your trip. Learn more about local taxes . Mileage Fee Most trips come with up to 200 miles (or 200km) included per 24-hour period, with 20 additional miles (15 km) for each additional hour (until up to 200 miles, or 200km, is reached). All additional mileage will be billed at $0.67/mile ($0.67CAD/km) upon completion of your trip. Some pay-per-mile cars or membership plans only include up to 180 miles or do not include free mileage. Parking Pass Replacement $225 if you lose or remove the parking pass from the Zipcar. Retrieval Fee You will be charged a flat fee at minimum if you do not return the Zipcar vehicle back to its home location by the end of your trip. $275 - New York market $250 - All other markets Roadside Assistance Fee A flat fee at minimum for roadside assistance due to member error such as running out of gas. $275 - New York market $250 - All other markets Tickets/Violation Processing Fee You are responsible for paying any parking tickets and moving violations incurred during your reservation. If we receive a notice and process a violation, a $30 processing fee will be assessed. Toll Charges All toll charges will be billed to your account after the trip ends. It may take a few weeks for Zipcar to learn of the tolls from the municipality, so it may take some time for the charges to appear. Learn more about our toll passes and policies . Towing and Storage Fee You are responsible for the cost of towing and storage if your reserved Zipcar is towed during your reservation or within 24 hours of the conclusion of your reservation due to illegal parking. Young Driver Fee A young driver fee applies to individuals between 18 and 24 years old when booking a trip within the United States and varies by location and renter age. The fee does not apply for trips started after a member turns 25. New York locations: Fees start at $4.50 per hour or $35.00 per day All other locations: Fees start at $3.50 per hour or $28.00 per day University members can access on-campus cars at lower rates: New York locations: Fees start at $2.25 per hour or $17.50 per day All other locations: Fees start at $0.75 per hour or $6.00 per day Zipcard Replacement Fee One free replacement card per year ($15 for each additional card). Learn more about your Zipcard .

title: How do I file tax exemption for myself or business?
body: Some businesses (and in rare cases, individuals) may be eligible for tax exemption. If you or your business is tax exempt, please email business@zipcar.com a copy of a state-issued exemption certificate . Keep In Mind The name and address on the tax exemption certification must match the information on your Zipcar account

title: I got into an accident, what should I do?
body: First and foremost, we hope you're safe. If you're involved in an accident, please follow these steps once it is safe to do so: Ensure your safety: Move to a safe location. Document the scene: Take clear photos of all damage and the accident surroundings. Contact the authorities: If required by local law, contact the police to file an official accident report. Always call 911 if the third party does not stop or if a tow is needed. Members are required to exchange information with any third party involved in the accident. Gather necessary information: Collect all details outlined in Section 7.4 of the Rules of Vehicle Use: ○ Date, time, and location of the incident ○ License plate, make, model year, VIN, and insurance info of all vehicles involved ○ Third Party's contact details ○ Contact information for witnesses, passengers, and others involved ○ Brief summary of the incident ○ Police report (if required) Notify Zipcar: Call us immediately at 866-4ZIPCAR (866-494-7227) to report the incident. Complete an incident report: After your call, you’ll receive an email and a text message with a link to submit a full incident report. Here are some things to know or keep in mind as we process the accident report: Account Status: Your Zipcar account will be suspended while we await your incident report. Once we receive your report, we will review your account and provide an update on your suspension within 3 business days. Vehicle Inspection: Zipcar will assess the vehicle for any damage and arrange for necessary repairs. More Information: For more information about the accident process, please refer to I was in an accident. What should I expect during the accident process?

title: How do I sign up for a new personal/family account?
body: To sign up for a Zipcar personal/family account, follow the steps below to submit your application: Find a plan that works for you on our membership pricing page Input your name, email address and password to create your account Follow the steps to upload your driver's license and take a selfie to verify your identity Input your billing information Submit your application Keep In Mind Most applications are instantly reviewed and approved or rejected In some cases, it may take several business days to fully review the application, and more information may be requested

title: How do I create a business account?
body: To submit an application to join Zipcar through your business, follow the steps below: Find and select a business plan on our business pricing page Input your personal & business information Follow the steps to upload your driver's license and take a selfie to verify your identity Note: This step is optional and only if you want to also be a driver of the account. You can always do this later if you skip this step Input your billing information Submit your application Note: This step only applies if you are submitting an application to drive Once you have created your business account, begin inviting drivers to join your account . Keep In Mind Large-scale businesses can apply for an Enterprise Membership Residential businesses can apply for a Residential Membership Most applications are instantly reviewed and approved or rejected In some cases, it may take several business days to fully review the application and more information may be requested All membership & driving-related fees of drivers on a business account will be charged to the business credit card on file

title: Is there a maximum or minimum booking length?
body: You can book a Zipcar for as little as one hour or as long as 14 days at a time. Bookings can be made in half-hour increments. When booking, keep in mind that the Zipcar you booked is available for others to reserve before and after your reservation. Make sure to give yourself enough time so that you don't impact another member's trip if you get caught in traffic.

title: How do hourly & daily rates work?
body: Hourly & Daily Rates Most vehicles have hourly and daily rates which vary by day of the week. When booking a vehicle, the hourly rate will be charged up to the daily rate of the vehicle, which is the maximum rate for a 24-hour period. Sometimes, it will be cheaper to pay the daily rate versus the hourly rate, even if you're booking a vehicle for less than a whole day. We'll do the math and quote you the least expensive rate. Hourly-Only Vehicles Some vehicles are hourly-only, meaning there is no daily rate available. These cars can be booked by the hour and do not have a daily maximum rate for a 24-hour period. Flat Rate Only Vehicles Some vehicles have a flat rate booking option only, meaning there is no hourly rate available. You can find Flat Rate Only vehicles by looking for the blue label when going to book. More information about how this pricing works can be found here. Keep In Mind Hourly and daily rates may vary over time due to discounts, availability, holidays, or other factors. Other fees may apply .

title: Who is allowed to drive my Zipcar during my trip?
body: Only active members are allowed to drive Zipcars. If you have a family account, other drivers on your account are authorized to drive the Zipcar. If a Zipcar member on a different account is driving the Zipcar you reserved, we ask you be along for the ride. All fees and charges , as well as damage fees , will be the responsibility of the reserving member. Keep in Mind Allowing non-members to drive your Zipcar would be a breach of the membership contract and may result in termination of membership

title: How do I pickup my Zipcar from a parking garage with a valet?
body: Some Zipcars are located in garages with valets and attendants who park and retrieve cars. Upon arriving at the garage, inform the attendant of which Zipcar you are picking up. Once the car is brought out to you, the attendant will need to close and lock the car before you are able to begin your trip . To begin your trip, use your Zipcard or unlock the car from your iPhone ® or Android ™ app.

title: What are the cleanliness community rules?
body: Zipcars are regularly inspected and cleaned, but we rely on our car sharing community to keep vehicles clean for others, and to let us know when cars need to be tidied up. Here are some cleaning expectations we have: Return the car as clean as (or cleaner than) you found it (inside and out) Let us know if a car is not as clean as you'd expect at the beginning of your trip (report through the Zipcar iPhone ® or Android ™ mobile app) No smoking, ever! Pets must be kept in locked carriers

title: What happens if I return late?
body: It’s important to return on time, as you could impact the next member’s trip. If you’re running late, you’ll be charged for the extra time you used the car, plus an additional late fee: 1- 60 minutes late: $50 ($50 CAD) 61–120 minutes late: $100 ($100 CAD) 121+ minutes late: $150 ($150 CAD) To avoid returning late: Book your trip well in advance while the car still has plenty of availability Take traffic into account and book enough time to complete your trip, refuel if below 1/4 tank, and clean out the car before ending your trip If the car is available, extend your trip from the “drive” screen in the app Turn on push notifications to receive trip status updates Keep In Mind Please call us at 866-4ZIPCAR if you are unable to return the car on time If you receive 3 late fees within a 12-month period, Zipcar will review your account and may suspend or end your membership

title: How can I reactivate my membership?
body: If you have recently cancelled your membership, your account will not be deactivated until the end of your current membership cycle. If your account is still scheduled for deactivation at a future date, you are able to un-cancel the request. If your membership has already been canceled, you can reactivate by following the steps below: Sign in to your Zipcar account Click on My Account at the top of the page and select Account Settings Click the Plan card Select Reactivate membership Keep In Mind If it has been more than 90 days since your account was deactivated, you will be prompted to submit a new application to have your account reactivated, and an application fee may be charged

title: Is gas included with my Zipcar trip?
body: Yes! Every Zipcar has a fuel card in the visor above the driver's seat that can be used when purchasing fuel. Keep in mind, Zipcar is a car sharing community. Please return your Zipcar with at least 1/4 tank of gas at the end of your trip, no matter how much it had at the start. If you're having issues with the fuel card, or if it is missing, click here .

title: Can I use a Zipcar for my driving test?
body: No, the use of Zipcars for driving tests is prohibited, as noted in the membership contract . Failure to adhere to the rules of vehicle use may result in termination of membership.

title: Can I drive my Zipcar outside of the country?
body: Zipcars can be freely driven between the United States and Canada and no additional documentation is needed. Keep mileage in mind if you’re planning on a lengthy trip. Zipcars cannot be driven outside of the US or Canada . Violation of this policy will result in termination of the Zipcar membership.

title: What out of pocket expenses are eligible for reimbursement?
body: Certain out of pocket expenses incurred during your Zipcar trip may be eligible for reimbursement. With the exception of fuel expenses, always be sure to give us a call to have the expense authorized before making your purchase . Eligible reimbursement expenses: Fuel - In the event the fuel card in your Zipcar does not work or is missing, we'll reimburse the cost of fueling up the car (but please be sure to report the fuel card issue via our mobile app so our team can look into it) Wiper Fluid - Up to $10 if your Zipcar is low on wiper fluid Wiper Blades - The cost of standard wiper blades if your Zipcar's blades are no longer fully functional Reimbursements are typically not offered for vehicle care expenses, including tire changes, new batteries, oil changes, and other services. For more information or support, please give us a call. Keep in Mind Requests must be submitted within 30 days of purchase Receipt images must clearly show the date, time, and amount of purchase Fuel receipts must show the final charge amount and gallons (or liters) and not a pre-authorized amount A screenshot or downloaded copy of your bank statement or posted bank statement can be submitted if you have lost the receipt Hand-written or digitally altered receipts are not accepted Uber Drivers are not eligible for fuel reimbursements Submit a Reimbursement Request

title: How can I reset or change my password?
body: If you are able to login to your Zipcar account: Sign in to your Zipcar account Click on My Account at the top of the page and select Account Settings Select the Password card Input your new password and select Update password If you are unable to login to your Zipcar account: Go to the Zipcar sign in page Select Forgot password? Input your email address Follow the password reset instructions sent to your email address

title: Can I join with a non-US driver's license?
body: Yes, international driver's licenses may be accepted when applying to join Zipcar. For more information on our eligibility requirements, including driving license requirements, click here.

title: How can I check the status of my application?
body: We are eager to get you on the road as quickly as possible, and most members are approved and can book in minutes. If you would like to check the status of your recently submitted application, please sign in to your account here . If your application has not been approved, a banner will be at the top of the page. Here are the more common states your application might be in: Application In Review Though most applications are decisioned quickly, it can sometimes take several business days if more information or review is needed Application Incomplete If you haven't completed and submitted your application, follow the link to complete the remaining steps Application Rejected In some cases, applications may be rejected from membership Tip Has it been a few days since you've completed your application? Hit the contact us button to get in touch.

title: How do I cancel my membership?
body: Did You Know? You can pause your monthly membership for up to three months, allowing you to take a breather without saying goodbye. For more information, check out this article ! Log in to your Zipcar account on the website or mobile app Go to My Account and click on your membership plan Click Cancel Membership You'll then be prompted to pause your membership for up to three months - Click Cancel Membership Finally, Cancel Membership once more, and you should see a screen confirming the cancellation Here are some things to keep in mind when canceling your Zipcar membership: Once your membership has been canceled, you may continue to book cars until the end of your billing cycle If you have a Family Plan, the memberships of all drivers on your account will be canceled as well, but they can book cars until the end of your billing cycle Any trips scheduled after your plan expires will be canceled If you have a remaining balance on your account, it will be charged or credited to your credit card on file when your account is canceled Additional trip costs, tolls, and violations will be charged once they are received If you change your mind and would like to resume your membership, you can reactivate your membership

title: Are hand-controlled vehicles available for members with disabilities?
body: Yes, we work to make hand-controlled vehicles available to our members who require them. It often takes a bit of time for us to find suitable vehicles and have the hand-controls installed, so we ask for a minimum of 72-hours notice if you require this service. Give us a call and our team will work to accommodate.

title: How do I update my phone number?
body: Note To update the phone number on your account, you will need access to the following: The new phone number you would like to connect to your account The phone number connected to your account You can update your phone number by following the steps. Sign in to your Zipcar account Click into your account and navigate to Personal Info or Account Settings Select Phone Input the new phone number Confirm your verification method and select Update Input the verification code sent via SMS to the phone number on file Input the verification code sent via SMS to the new phone number Keep In Mind If Optimum is your service provider, you may not receive verification codes. Use the form below to reach out for assistance. If your phone number is inaccessible, please look at this article for steps to recover access to your Zipcar account. Submit a Support Request

title: How do I update my email address?
body: Note To update the email address on your account, you will need access to the following: The email inbox currently associated with your Zipcar account Access to the phone number connected to your account You can update your email address by following the steps. Sign in to your Zipcar account Click into your account and navigate to Personal Info or Account Settings Select Email Input the new email address Confirm your verification method and select Update Input the verification code sent via SMS to the phone number on file Input the verification code sent via email to the new email address Keep In Mind If your phone number is inaccessible, please look at this article for steps to recover access to your Zipcar account.

title: How can I update my notification settings?
body: Managing notification preferences in the Zipcar mobile app: To turn on text messages and/or push notifications or receive emails from Zipcar on your mobile app, follow the steps below: Navigate to your app home screen and select account Scroll down and select Notification settings On the Notifications screen, use the toggles to modify your notification preferences Managing notification preferences in a web browser: To turn on text messages and/or push notifications or receive emails on a web browser, follow the steps below: Sign in to your account Click on My Account at the top of the page and select Account Settings Select the Notifications card Use the toggles to configure your notification preferences and select Update notifications

title: Why was my Zipcar booking moved to another car or cancelled?
body: Why did Zipcar move my booking? When unforeseen car, location, or member issues arise, we must occasionally move a member to a vehicle other than the one originally reserved. We understand how disruptive this can be and work to notify our members of the adjustment as soon as we become aware of an issue. When your reservation is moved due to issues outside of your control you will always pay the lower price between the two vehicles . Some things we prioritize when moving reservations: Timeframe Keep the same start time, end time, and location of the reservation Vehicle Type If a specialized vehicle is reserved, such as a Zipvan, we will always try to move the booking into the same or similar type of vehicle Location If the same vehicle type is not available, we will move the reservation to the nearest available car What if this new vehicle doesn't work for me? If your new car doesn’t work for you and you’d like to move to a different vehicle or location, give us a call at 866-4ZIPCAR and we will work to find another car that better meets your needs. You can always cancel the reservation and have it refunded within our cancellation window . Outside of this timeframe, feel free to give us a call at 866-4ZIPCAR and we will be happy to cancel and refund the reservation. Why did Zipcar cancel my booking? As a last resort, we may need to cancel your Zipcar trip if we are unable to source another vehicle at a suitable location for you. A full refund will be provided if this occurs.

title: What's included with my Zipcar trip?
body: Driving with Zipcar has its perks. Here is some of what is included in all bookings: Gas is on us , gas cards are in every Zipcar At least 180 miles included with each trip (may depend on your membership plan ) A free, designated parking spot 24-hour Roadside Assistance @ 866-4ZIPCAR

title: My reserved Zipcar is not parked where it should be or isn't here, what should I do?
body: If you've booked a Zipcar and it isn't where it should be at the start of your trip, here are some things to check: Confirm you have the correct date, time, and location Make sure that your booking time has actually started (it's possible someone else has the car until your trip begins) Use the mobile app to honk the horn on the vehicle in case it has been parked nearby If you still can't find your booked Zipcar, give us a call and we will work to help locate it, or place you in another suitable vehicle in the area.

title: I forgot an item in a Zipcar, what can I do?
body: If you've forgotten an item in a Zipcar, you can make a booking and return to the vehicle at your earliest convenience. If you need help creating the booking, give us a call and we'll assist. Be sure to check the car's glove compartment and trunk when you return to the vehicle (that's typically where good Samaritans return forgotten items). Keep in Mind We are unable to cancel or interrupt any bookings on the vehicle We are unable to put you in touch directly with the member who used the car following your trip We are unable to contact the last member in the vehicle Zipcar is not responsible for forgotten or stolen items

title: How do I pay an overdue balance on my account?
body: If you have an overdue balance, it might be because we were unable to process a payment using the payment method on your account. To pay your overdue balance, please update your payment method. You can update your payment method by following these steps: Mobile: Go to the Account tab at the bottom right of your Zipcar Mobile App Click on the Wallet tab in your Account Settings Under payment methods, select Add a Payment Method Enter your card information on the next screen Select Confirm Payment to add your card Website: Go to the My Account tab at the top right of the website Click on the Wallet tab Next to payment methods, select Add a Payment Method Enter your card information on the next screen Select Confirm Payment to add your card Your new payment method should be charged automatically. Once your payment has been processed successfully, you will be able to continue to book and drive Zipcars. Keep In Mind If you have backup payments enabled on your account, you agree to let Zipcar charge alternative payment methods as a backup when needed. Overdue balances cannot be paid using Google or Apple Pay.

title: What do I need to know before my first Trip?
body: For the best Zipcar experience, approved members should follow the steps below: Download our iPhone ® or Android ™ app to book your first trip and start driving. After you've booked your trip, the app may ask you to enable Location and Bluetooth . These permissions allow you to access the car. Use the mobile app to lock and unlock the car . The keys should always remain inside the vehicle . Note : Some members may have physical Zipcards , which will also allow you to lock and unlock the vehicle. Before you start driving, inspect your Zipcar inside and out and report any problems via our iPhone® or Android™ app. Gas is included in your trip. There is a g as card inside every Zi pca r ( in the visor above the driver's seat ) that should be used to pay for gas . Return your Zipcar to its home location on time , clean , and with at least 1/4 tank of gas to avoid extra fees . Trips in clude up to 200 miles per day in the US and 200 kilometers per day in Canada ( mileage may vary depending on your membership plan ).

title: What is Zipcar's policy on pets and animals?
body: Pets are not allowed in Zipcars unless they are in locked pet carriers . Members are subject to fees if evidence of pet hair is found in the vehicle they have reserved. We do waive the requirement for pets in carriers for members with service animals.

title: Why is my account suspended and what can I do?
body: While your account is suspended, you will be unable to make bookings , change existing bookings, or unlock a Zipcar, but will still have access to sign in and review account settings and billing information. Accounts may be suspended for a number of reasons, including: Account has been compromised by an unauthorized user Account involved in an accident in a Zipcar Account involved in a missing or unreturned Zipcar Balance due on an account for more than three weeks Violations of Zipcar rules around late returns or car cleanliness Violations of the member contract If your account is suspended, you can make a request to have it unsuspended. Any decision made at that point will be final and ineligible for further review.

title: How old must I be to book a Zipvan, luxury, and other specialty cars?
body: To book a Zipvan, you must be 21+ years old. To book specialty vehicles, including minivans, trucks, & luxury cars, you must be 25+ years old.

title: How can I find where my booked Zipcar is parked?
body: After making a booking, you will find details about the location of the Zipcar you booked on the confirmation page of the website, on the booking page of the mobile app, as well as in your booking confirmation email. Details will include the address, pictures of the location, and any location-specific instructions to help you pickup your Zipcar. If your Zipcar is located in a garage there may be additional steps you need to take to pickup your car. If you're having trouble finding your Zipcar at its location, try honking the horn from the Zipcar mobile app. If you're still unable to locate the car, give us a call at 866-4ZIPCAR .

title: How do I redeem promotional & driving credit?
body: Redeeming Driving Credit Android & iOS Login to your account on the Zipcar app From the bottom menu, select Account Select Wallet in the account settings and then Driving credit Select the + icon in the top right-hand corner Enter the credit code and select Redeem Zipcar Website Login to your account on the Zipcar website Select Account settings from the top right & select Wallet Select Add credit Enter the credit code and select Redeem Redeeming Booking Promotions Login to your account on the Zipcar app or website On the booking checkout screen, select Add promo code Input a promo code or select from available promotions in your inventory If the booking meets the promotion criteria, the discount will be applied to the cost of your booking Keep In Mind Driving credit expires, so be sure to check the expiration date after adding credit to your account Check a list of our our current promotions

title: What are the 3 Zipcar community rules?
body: When you share a Zipcar, you also share responsibility. These rules make sure every member enjoys their trip and helps you avoid fees. Win-win : Return to the car’s home location on time, or you’ll be charged for the extra time you used the car plus a late fee . No smoking and please clean up after yourself—otherwise, a cleaning fee of $50 will apply ($150 for smoking). If gas is below a ¼ tank, use the gas card in the visor to fill up, or you’ll be charged a $30 fee.

title: How do I lock & unlock my Zipcar?
body: You can lock & unlock your Zipcar using the Zipcar iPhone ® or Android ™ mobile app or using your physical Zipcard if you have one. To lock & unlock with the Zipcar app: Open the "Drive" screen on your Zipcar app From here, you can locate the car using the map or by tapping the pickup location row for directions. If you're having trouble, try using the "honk" action to find the car Once you're next to the vehicle, tap unlock. If Bluetooth is not connected, the app will guide you to enable this permission. It's required to access our vehicles via the app When you're leaving the vehicle, be sure to tap lock from the same screen as before. No need to use the keys (which should always remain in the car!) For members with a Zipcard: Place your Zipcard over the Zipcar reader on the windshield (driver's side) Hold the Zipcard for 10-30 seconds, or until you hear a beep Tip If you are still unable to lock or unlock your vehicle, please refer to this troubleshooting article

title: What happens in the event a vehicle is recalled by the manufacturer?
body: The safety of our members is our first priority, and we take recalls seriously. In the event Zipcar receives a recall notice, we will identify the affected vehicles in our fleet and remove them from our reservation system, preventing them from being used. Then we will address the recall according to the manufacturer’s instructions. During this process, if members have a reservation for a vehicle that’s part of a recall, we’ll move you to another Zipcar or change your reservation before your trip.

title: Does Zipcar have a Flex or One Way service?
body: No, only round-trip bookings are currently available on Zipcars across North America. This means that your car must be picked up and dropped off at the same Zipcar location. Flexible bookings are currently only available in our London market. More information on the UK Flex program can be found here .

title: What is the Zipcar for Uber program?
body: Zipcar and Uber have partnered to create a unique offering for Uber drivers. Drivers can join the Zipcar membership and rent Zipcars to drive & earn for Uber. This partnership allows drivers access to special Zipcar rental rates, rent from a diversified electric-forward fleet, 24/7 roadside assistance, and much more. The program is currently in the following metro areas: Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Baltimore, Washington DC, Chicago, Miami, Denver, Atlanta, Seattle, Pittsburgh, and New Jersey. Joining How do I signup for the Zipcar for Uber program ? To join the Zipcar for Uber program, login to your Uber account and visit Uber’s Vehicle Marketplace in your Uber app or on the web and select Zipcar as the daily option. Create your Zipcar account and complete the driver application. You can also apply here . Once approved, you will be able to rent Zipcar for Uber reservations on the Uber Marketplace or Zipcar app. Most applications are approved within minutes. However, some applications can take up to two business days to be reviewed. I'm already a Zipcar member, can I join the Zipcar for Uber program? If you are already a Zipcar member, you can join the Zipcar for Uber program by signing up through the Uber Driver marketplace. Simply use the same email address and our system will match your accounts. This allows you to toggle between reservations you intend to use an Uber driver and reservations that are for personal use. Can I sign up for a personal membership if I am in the Zipcar for Uber program ? Zipcar for Uber drivers can open personal membership accounts with Zipcar. Application fees are typically waived when opening a secondary account but are subject to recurring membership fees. To open a personal account, login to your Zipcar account and open your Account Settings . From there select View Plans & Pricing , select the membership which meets your needs, and complete the sign-up process. After your application is approved, you can reserve and drive cars using your personal account. How old do I need to be to join the Zipcar for Uber program? Drivers must be 25 years or older. Are there any start-up or recurring costs to joining the Zipcar for Uber program? There are no application or membership costs associated with the Zipcar for Uber program. How much does it cost to rent a Zipcar under a Zipcar for Uber program ? The daily cost to rent a Zipcar can vary; we recommend visiting the Uber Vehicle Solutions site to see current rates. Can I drive for personal matters in the Zipcar for Uber program ? No, the Zipcar for Uber program is specifically for Uber driving purposes only. Can I use a Zipcar for Uber program vehicle to drive for Uber Eats Yes, you can use the Zipcar for Uber program to drive for Uber Eats. To sign up for the program, see how to join here . Booking & Driving I booked a car through the Zipcar app, why don't I see the car in my Uber app? Your Zipcar bookings will be visible in the Uber app approximately 1-hour before the start of your trip. If your booking has started and you do not see the car in the Uber app, please call us at 866-4ZIPCAR for assistance. Are there requirements for my Zipcar for Uber reservation? Yes, all drivers must complete a minimum of 8 Uber rides per 24-hour booking period. Does Zipcar provide an Uber Driver Kit or other trade dress accessories ? Zipcar does not provide any trade dress accessories. Drivers will need to bring their kit with them to their rental. How many miles are included in my Zipcar for Uber reservation? There are no mileage limitations for Zipcar for Uber reservations. Is EV charging or fuel included in my Zipcar for Uber reservations? EV charging is covered by Zipcar - use the charge card placed in the visor to pay for electric charging costs. The cost of fuel (in our limited internal combustion engine & hybrid feet) is not covered by Zipcar. How much EV charge or fuel should I return my car with? EVs should be returned with at least 20% charge. Internal combustion engines & hybrid vehicles should be returned with the same fuel level as the start of the trip (and at least 1/4 tank). Vehicles not returned with the expected charge or fuel levels are subject to additional fees . Account Management Can I add Additional Liability Insurance to my Zipcar for Uber reservations? At this time Additional Liability Insurance is not available for Zipcar for Uber reservations. Can I add Damage Protection to my Zipcar for Uber reservations? If you're age 25+, and have had no Zipcar accidents in the past 12 months, you are eligible to purchase damage protection to eliminate the damage fee. Purchasing damage protection won't change your insurance coverage, it just changes the maximum amount you'll be charged if you're involved in an incident with your Zipcar. Damage protection plans can be purchased per trip and rates may vary. How does insurance work? If you participate in the Zipcar for Uber program, the insurance maintained by Zipcar while you drive differs from if you were to drive a Zipcar as a Zipcar member. If you are already covered by other vehicle insurance, you agree that that vehicle insurance will be the primary insurance, with any insurance listed below to be secondary. If you are not otherwise covered by vehicle insurance, then the following insurance will apply in the periods indicated. To obtain coverage in the event of a claim, you have a duty to fully cooperate, and you must be in compliance with all other Uber and Zipcar terms and conditions. Uber may also maintain commercial auto insurance on your behalf. Click here for more details about the commercial auto insurance that Uber maintains on behalf of independent drivers transporting passengers via the Uber App. Stage Damage to vehicle Liability insurance Your Uber app is off (offline) Zipcar to cover in excess of the $1,000 deductible Zipcar to provide liability coverage up to the minimum financial responsibility limits required in the state/jurisdiction in which the accident occurs Your Uber app is on (available and waiting for a trip request) Zipcar to cover in excess of the $1,000 deductible Uber to maintain liability coverage of at least $50,000 bodily injury per person, $100,000 bodily injury maximum, and $25,000 property damage. Your Uber app is on (en-route or on-trip) Zipcar to cover in excess of the $1,000 deductible Uber to maintain liability coverage of at least $1,000,000 CSL (combined single limit) per accident and at least $250,000 for uninsured and underinsured motorist bodily injury when traveling with a passenger. See program terms here .

title: Where can I find Zipcar's privacy notice?
body: The Zipcar privacy notice can be found here .

title: How do I invite drivers to join my standard plan or business account?
body: As an owner or admin of an account, you can invite others to join and drive under your account by following the below steps: Login to your Zipcar account Click on My Account at the top of the page and select Account Settings Select the People tab Select +Add Member Input the email address of the new member Select the damage protection coverage Click Send Invite Keep In Mind Only owners & admins of a standard plan or business account can add members For Standard Plans only one additional driver is allowed All fees & charges of the member will be billed to the credit card associated with the standard plan or business account If the invited user does not already have a Zipcar membership, they will be asked to go through the application process

title: What is additional liability insurance (ALI)?
body: Additional Liability Protection (optional supplemental liability insurance) may be available for purchase for hourly or daily trips you take with Zipcar in the United States. If you decide to purchase this additional protection, it provides you excess coverage up to $300,000 under a policy of insurance offered by a third party insurance company if claims are made by third parties against you while you were using a Zipcar. For purposes of this policy, you may be referred to as a “rentee” under the policy, which is an “Excess Automobile Liability Insurance Policy” that provides additional liability insurance, within specified limits, above the limits provided in the Zipcar Member Agreement – referenced under “Third Party Liability” Section. The additional liability insurance coverage limits equal the difference between the maximum $300,000 combined Single limit under the policy and the liability protection limits provided under the Zipcar Member Agreement – referenced under “Third Party Liability” Section. What is Additional Liability Protection? Additional Liability Protection insures you against claims made by third parties against you, the member, for bodily injury/death and property damage caused by the use or operation of a Zipcar vehicle in accordance with the Zipcar Member Agreement. This coverage is a separate insurance policy issued to Zipcar by a third party insurance company. More details about the coverage terms and conditions are summarized here . It is made available to you when booking a Zipcar vehicle. If you elect to purchase it for an additional hourly or daily charge as shown at the time of booking, you are covered while driving your Zipcar vehicle within the United States and Canada, but only if the trip begins and ends in the United States. Zipcar vehicles may not be taken into Mexico, and this coverage does not apply in Mexico. Rates may vary by state. If you purchase this insurance at the time of reservation, the insurance coverage is restricted only to the vehicle rented in that reservation and only for the period the coverage is purchased for the respective rental vehicle in the same reservation. Your personal insurance policy providing coverage on an owned automobile, or other personal policy, may provide additional coverage, and to that extent, the Additional Liability Protection may provide a duplication of coverage. To determine whether, at what point, and to what extent your own policies apply, you should check the terms of the policies themselves as these terms frequently vary. The protection afforded by Additional Liability Protection is primary to your own policies. This means that before your own policies would apply to pay a claim, the $300,000 protection afforded by the combination of Additional Liability Protection and the Zipcar Membership Agreement limits would have to be exhausted. How to add Additional Liability Protection If available, you can purchase Additional Liability Protection for an hourly or daily trip in the United States in the app or on our website when booking a reservation. To purchase this insurance for your hourly or daily trip, click on additional liability protection and select Add protection . Rates may vary by state. Keep In Mind Additional Liability Protection purchases are non-refundable after your trip has started ALI will not apply if members are not in compliance with the Zipcar Member Agreement Members engaging in prohibited uses of Zipcar will not covered by Additional Liability Protection This is only a general summary of Additional Liability Protection and only the policy governs the terms and conditions of coverage - please consult the policy via the links below Additional Liability Protection Brochures General brochure (all other states not listed below) Florida Louisiana Maryland New Hampshire New York Washington

title: How can I make a privacy rights request?
body: Depending on your state of residency and subject to certain legal limitations and exceptions, you may be able to exercise some or all of the following rights: The Right to Know/Access/Portability The right to obtain access to the personal information we have collected about you and, where required by law, the right to obtain a copy of the personal information in a portable and, to the extent technically feasible, readily usable format that allows you to transmit the data to another entity. To make a right to know/access/portability request, follow these steps: Sign in to your Zipcar account Submit your request for records The Right to Request Deletion The right to request the deletion of personal information we have collected from you, subject to certain exceptions. To make a right to deletion request, follow these steps: Sign in to your Zipcar account Submit your request for data deletion The Right to Correction The right to correct inaccuracies in your personal information, taking into account the nature of the personal information and the purposes of the processing of the personal information. You may be able to make corrections yourself by logging into your account and navigating to the Account Settings page. Learn more about updating your account information here .

title: Why does my upcoming booking show the vehicle as unassigned?
body: When a vehicle you had booked for your trip requires unanticipated maintenance that must be addressed immediately, we may have to temporarily remove the vehicle from your booking . This doesn't necessarily mean that the car you booked won't be available at the time of your trip, but it is a possibility. Rest assured, our team will make every attempt to get you back into your original vehicle and if not, we will work to get you into a suitable alternative . This can take some time, so we ask that you bear with us as we work on getting your vehicle road ready again. If a new vehicle is required for your trip, we'll notify you via email as soon as your trip has been updated. Keep In Mind If your trip is starting in the next 24 hours and you notice that your vehicle ’s details are still missing, please feel free to call us at 866-4ZIPCAR

title: Can Zipcar provide an experience letter of insurance for my current automotive insurance provider?
body: At this time, Zipcar does not offer experience letters of insurance to current or past members. An experience letter of insurance is a statement of confirmation that an individual held an auto insurance policy for a period of time. For car owners, these letters can help confirm previous or current coverage and potentially result in a discounted rate from an insurance company.

title: How do I take my Zipcar in and out of a garage that requires a parking pass or code?
body: After booking your Zipcar, you can find location details in the mobile app, in your confirmation email, or on the website. These details will include instructions and pictures to help you locate and access your Zipcar. There will also be information on parking passes and gate codes and if the car is in an enclosed garage. Parking passes will typically be located in the visor above the driver's seat, along with the car's gas card. It might also be in the glove compartment, cup holder, set on the dashboard, or left in the door storage area. If the provided gate code does not work, or if the vehicle is missing the parking pass to gain entry/exit to the garage, give us a call so we can troubleshoot and help you get on your way.

title: What should I do if I'm unable to return my Zipcar to its spot or location?
body: If you're having difficulty returning your Zipcar to the garage or parking spot it belongs to, open up the location details of the car's home location to see if any guidance or troubleshooting is available. You can find this information in your booking confirmation email, or on the My Trips section of your mobile app (find the trip and select View Details ). There you might find helpful tips on what to do if the parking spot is occupied, the garage is closed, an entry parking pass is missing, or if you're having a problem with having the car valeted. If you continue to experience parking issues, or if the troubleshooting information provided doesn't resolve your issue, contact us for assistance.

title: How do I update my name?
body: You can update the name on your account on a web browser by following the steps below: Sign in to your account Click on My Account at the top of the page and select Account Settings Click the Name card under your personal information Input your first & last name and select Update name

title: How do I update my driver's license information?
body: You can update your driver's license information by signing into your account on a web browser and following the steps below: Sign in to your account Click on My Account at the top of the page and select Account Settings Click on the Driver's License card Enter your license details in the space provided and click Continue Keep In Mind You can currently only update your driver's license information via a web browser

title: How do I join a promotional membership plan?
body: If you are creating a new account, you may be eligible to receive discounts or promotions offered by a sponsoring business or organization. One example of this is AARP, which offers promotional membership plans with Zipcar. Available incentives and offerings will vary by promotional program, but may include a discounted first-year membership fee, waived application fee, or driving credit (upon approval of application). To join a promotional membership plan, please contact the sponsoring organization directly. An admin or representative of the promotional program will provide a unique URL that will allow you to receive promotional discounts. Keep In Mind Zipcar is unable to provide the contact information of promotional account admins Zipcar is unable to provide unique join links to a promotional rate plan Promotional membership plans are only available to new members upon joining. Eligible memberships may be able to change to a promotional rate plan. Please see How do I change my membership plan? for more details)

title: How do I invite new admins to join my business account?
body: As an owner or admin of an account, you can invite other admins to join and manage your account by following the below steps: Sign in to your Zipcar account Click on My Account at the top of the page and select Account Settings Select the People tab Select +Add Member Select the Admin only role Input the email address(es) of the new admins Click Send Invite Keep In Mind Only owners & admins of a business account can add new admins After a new admin joins, their role can be updated to include driving access

title: How do I remove drivers from my account?
body: If you have multiple drivers on your account, you can remove them at any time by following the below steps: Sign in to your Zipcar account Click on My Account at the top of the page and select Account Settings Select the People tab and search for the user you wish to remove Click the overflow menu (3 vertical dots) Select Remove member Keep In Mind Only owners & admins of a family or business account can remove members

title: How do I update the roles of users on my business account?
body: Admins and owners of business accounts can modify the roles of any user on the account to a driver , admin , or combination of admin & driver by following the below steps: Sign in to your Zipcar account Click on My Account at the top of the page and select Account Settings Select the People tab Click the overflow menu (3 vertical dots) next to the driver you would like to update Select Update role Check the boxes of the roles you would like the user to have and click Update role Repeat the above steps for each user you would like to update the roles of. Keep In Mind Only admins and owners of a business account can update user roles Users who have all roles removed will be removed from the account

title: How do I resend an invitation to another user to join my account?
body: If you have invited another user to join your family or business account, an invitation email will be sent to the email address provided. If the user can't find the email we sent them, or if the link to join your account has expired, you can resend the invitation to them by following the below steps: Sign in to your Zipcar account Click on My Account at the top of the page and select Account Settings Select the People tab Search for the user to resend the invitation to Click the overflow menu (3 vertical dots) Select Resend invitation Keep In Mind Only owners & admins of a family or business account can resend invitations to drivers.

title: How do I rescind an invitation to a user to join my account?
body: If you have invited a user to join your family or business account, an invitation email will be sent to the email address provided. If the user has not completed their application yet, you can rescind the invitation from the user to join your account by following the below steps: Sign in to your Zipcar account Click on My Account at the top of the page and select Account Settings Select the People tab Search for the user to resend the invitation to Click the overflow menu (3 vertical dots) Select Remove member Keep In Mind Only owners & admins of a family or business account can revoke invitations or remove members.

title: How do I create a student, faculty, or alumni account through my university?
body: To submit an application to join Zipcar through your university, follow the steps below: Find and select your school on our university page Select a student, alumni, or faculty & staff plan Input your name, university email address and password to create your account Follow the steps to upload your driver's license and take a selfie to verify your identity Input your billing information Submit your application Keep In Mind Most applications are instantly reviewed and approved or rejected A University Department Account puts all drivers on your staff on a single account to help you streamline your transportation and budget management. There’s no setup fee—just an annual membership fee for each driver. To set up a university department account click here to submit a request. In some cases, it may take several business days to fully review the application and more information may be requested.

title: How do I join an existing family or business account?
body: Whether you already have a Zipcar account or membership, you have the ability to join and drive under a family or business account other than your own. To join an account, you must be invited by an admin or owner of the account. Once invited, you will receive an email invitation to join the account and, for users who don't already have a Zipcar membership, be invited to submit an application to drive. We encourage users to reach out directly to the admins and owners of family and business accounts directly to request an invitation to join their account. Keep In Mind Zipcar is unable to provide the admin or owner contact information of a family or business account Zipcar is unable to add drivers directly to a family or business account If you are invited to join a family or business account, an active account and approved application to drive are required

title: Am I eligible to create a student, faculty, or alumni account?
body: Zipcar has partnerships with hundreds of universities across North America. To join a university account, you must: Be associated with a university Zipcar is partnered with Have access to a valid .edu email address with the university Be an active student, alumni, or faculty/staff member of the university Discounts and perks associated with a university membership will vary by university and association. Full details can be found here . Keep In Mind All applicants will be asked to verify their .edu email address when applying to join Zipcar

title: Can I have multiple credit cards on my account?
body: Yes, you may have up to 10 payment methods added to your Zipcar wallet. Only one card can be used at a time to pay for any amount due. To update your payment information, follow the steps in this guide .

title: How can I update my email address if I no longer have access to that email?
body: Experiencing login issues with your Zipcar account due to a lost email? We've got your back. To regain access and update your email, let's verify your identity. Email us at account-recovery@zipcar.com with these details: Your current Zipcar account email The new email you want to use (make sure to email us from this address) Explain the issue preventing login or email update Snap a clear photo of your driver's license (matching your account) Take a picture holding your license (showing your face and the license) If your license address differs, send a matching document (utility bill, etc.) Keep In Mind If you are still able to login to your Zipcar account but no longer have access to your email inbox, you can still update your email by having a verification code sent to the phone number on file. Instructions can be found here .

title: I found a lost item in a Zipcar, what should I do?
body: If you find a lost item in a Zipcar, please place it in the glove compartment or the trunk. If it is an item of considerable value or something that may be time-sensitive, such as medication, please give us a call for assistance.

title: Should I take the Zipcar keys out of the car during my trip?
body: No, the car keys should stay in the Zipcar at all times. To lock & unlock your Zipcar, use your iPhone ® or Android ™ mobile app or Zipcard.
