title: How do I change the damage protection coverage for drivers on my business account?
body: As an admin or owner of a business account, you can manage the damage protection associated with all drivers on your account by following the below steps: Sign in to your Zipcar account Click on My Account at the top of the page and select Account Settings Under Account info , click on Damage Protection Select the level of protection you would like Select Update protection Keep In Mind Only owners & admins of a business account can update damage protection coverage Damage protection cannot be set on a driver-basis for business account

title: How can I purchase damage or liability protection on my trip?
body: Insurance coverage can be purchased in a couple of different ways, depending on what protection you are looking for. Subscribing to Damage Protection If you would like to purchase a recurring damage protection subscription, this can be done by following the steps below: Sign in to your Zipcar account Click on My Account at the top of the page and select Account Settings Click on Damage protection Select the insurance protection level you would like Click Update protection Purchasing Damage or Liability Protection per Trip If a subscription isn't your thing, you can also purchase our damage and liability protection on a per-trip basis. When creating your booking, you will be asked if you would like to purchase any additional insurance coverage upon checkout. Sign in to your Zipcar account Search and select a vehicle to book Select the insurance coverage you would like Click Book this car to checkout Keep In Mind If you are driving on a business account, only the business admin or owner is able to configure the damage protection coverage Additional Liability Insurance (ALI) is currently unavailable for members driving on a business account

title: Do I need a Zipcard to drive a Zipcar?
body: No, a Zipcard is not needed as all of our US Zipcars have Bluetooth® technology. This technology allows your mobile phone to lock, unlock, as well as start and end trips on all US Zipcars from the iPhone ® or Android ™ app . If you would still like to have a Zipcard, please send a request using this link .

title: Are there discounted driving rates overnight?
body: Some cities have promotional overnight rates for bookings between 6pm and 8:30am, Monday through Thursday. You can book at any point during these hours to get the discounted rate. If the hourly fee is less than the overnight bundle, you'll be charged the lesser of the two rates. The overnight rate varies depending on the vehicle and location, and our system will automatically charge the lowest available rate depending on the length and time of your reservation. Keep In Mind If you begin your Zipcar trip before 6pm or extend your reservation beyond 8:30am, the overnight rate will no longer apply Bookings which include overnight periods but extend outside the overnight window are not eligible for the discounted rate

title: I'm having trouble unlocking with my phone, what should I do?
body: If you're having trouble locking & unlocking your Zipcar from the iPhone ® or Android ™ mobile app, here are some things to try: Confirm location services , bluetooth , & cellular data are enabled in your phone's settings If bluetooth is already on, try toggling it off and back on Grant precise location access to the Zipcar app when prompted (if you're not prompted, go into your phone's settings and manually grant access ) Be sure you're standing right next to the car If all else fails, try your Zipcard Still having problems? Be sure that all the necessary permissions have been enabled for the Zipcar app. More information on how to manually enable those permissions can be found here .

title: Can I unlock my car while in a garage with poor or no reception?
body: All members are able to access Zipcars in areas of poor or no cellular reception. All of our US vehicles have Bluetooth® technology which allows you to lock, unlock, start, and end trips on all Zipcars from the iPhone ® or Android ™ app .

title: How can I change the owner of my account?
body: Ownership is typically non-transferrable. However, there may be cases in which the owner of a business account (the user who created the account) needs to be changed. If the owner of an account is no longer with the business, our team of account specialists will be able to assist to ensure ownership is transferred to a new responsible party. To be eligible for an ownership transfer, the following criteria must be met: The original owner must no longer be with the business is an administrative capacity The proposed replacement owner must have an admin account with the business An email with the documents listed below must be sent from the proposed replacement owner If your business account fits the above criteria, please email business@zipcar.com with the below information: Employment verification Typically a letter from a human resources or similar department, though some organizations use a 3rd party for employment verification Employee badge or business card Letter from management or higher (on company letterhead) confirming and authorizing the request

title: How can I see how much driving credit is currently available on my account?
body: You can review the available driving credit on your account by following the steps below: To view your driving credit expiration dates in the Zipcar Mobile App: Always ensure the Zipcar app is up-to-date! Open up the app and click on Account at the bottom right Tap on Wallet Under your payment methods, look for the Driving credit section Tapping on the amount will show you your driving credit history To view your driving credit expiration dates on the Website: Sign in to your Zipcar account Click on My account from in the top right corner and then Account settings Click on Wallet and scroll down until you see your Driving Credit section Click Show details from the driving credit card as shown below Review the available credit

title: Does driving credit expire?
body: Yes, driving credit does have an expiration date. Credit not used prior to the expiration date will be removed from your account. You can review the available driving credit on your account and the expiration date by following the steps below: To view your driving credit expiration dates in the Zipcar Mobile App: Always ensure the Zipcar app is up-to-date! Open up the app and click on Account at the bottom right Tap on Wallet Under your payment methods, look for the Driving credit section Tapping on the amount will show you your driving credit history and expiration dates To view your driving credit expiration dates on the Website: Sign in to your Zipcar account Click on My account from in the top right corner and then Account settings Click on Wallet and scroll down until you see your Driving Credit section Click Show details from the driving credit card as shown below Review the available credit and expiration dates

title: How do I modify or cancel my booking?
body: Shortening, extending, or canceling your booking, or updating the insurance protection coverage, can be done from the web or from the Zipcar app on iPhone ® or Android ™. Sign in to your Zipcar account Select Trips from the navigation menu Find the trip you wish to modify and select Edit To modify the trip times, use the timeline slider and select Update To change your booked Zipcar, click on Change car under the vehicle image, select your preferred vehicle, and select Update To cancel your trip, select Cancel trip at the bottom of the modal To update the insurance coverage, select or deselect available protection options and click Update Keep In Mind Cancellation fees may apply in some cases

title: Do I pay for toll charges when using a Zipcar?
body: Yes, members are responsible for paying all toll charges. While we don't charge you extra fees, you will be responsible for any and all tolls incurred during your trip. It may take a few weeks for Zipcar to receive the tolls from the municipality or local authority. Toll fees will appear in the list of charges for the associated trip and will be processed as a separate charge, to either the same card used to book or the account default card if the trip was booked using Apple Pay or Google Pay. You'll also receive an email from us anytime you're billed for a toll charge. You can find your trip summaries and invoices on your account page here . Keep In Mind Zipcars use pay-by-plate. Be sure to take pay-by-plate toll lanes. Do not use a personal toll pass as this may result in double-charging by the toll authority, and Zipcar is unable to remove toll charges incurred during a reservation

title: The fuel card isn't working, what can I do?
body: If the fuel card in your car isn't working, here are some things to keep in mind that might help: Make sure you're only trying to purchase gas Always try paying at the pump If a pre-authorization amount is requested, input $50 or less If you are prompted to input a zip code, enter your billing zip code Avoid filling the tank with small amounts of gas or using the fuel card multiple times over a short period of time If you continue to experience issues and the fuel card doesn't cooperate, please pay for fuel on your own and submit your receipts to be reimbursed .

title: If I don't end my Zipcar trip, will it end automatically?
body: Yes, as long as the car has been returned to its home location, the ignition is off, and the doors have been closed and locked, your trip will automatically end at the end-time of your booking. Keep In Mind Keep in mind, you will continue to have access to the vehicle until your trip has ended

title: If I return my Zipcar early, can I still drive it?
body: Yes, if you return your Zipcar to the home location early and do not end your trip, you will continue to have access to your Zipcar until the booking time ends. Learn more about ending your trip here .

title: If I return my Zipcar early and end my trip, will I be refunded for unused time?
body: No, you are charged at the time of booking for the duration booked. Trips which are ended early are not eligible for a prorated refund for unused time. Ending your trip will make the car available to be booked by others.

title: What is damage protection coverage?
body: If you're age 18+, and have had no Zipcar accidents in the past 12 months, you are eligible to purchase damage protection to reduce or eliminate the damage fee . Purchasing damage protection won't change your insurance coverage, it just changes the maximum amount you'll be charged if there is damage to your Zipcar. Damage protection plans can be purchased on a per-trip basis, or via a monthly or annual subscription. The following damage protection plans are currently available: Standard protection (included in membership) $2,500 fee per Zipcar may apply Plus protection $375 fee per Zipcar may apply Premium protection $0 per Zipcar Keep In Mind Damage protection waivers are non-refundable and become effective at the purchase date and time Terms & conditions can be found in the membership contract

title: Can I use a Zipcar as a taxi or ride share service?
body: Zipcar and Uber have partnered to launch the Zipcar for Uber program. This partnership allows Uber drivers to sign up through Uber’s Vehicle Marketplace to rent Zipcars at a discounted rate and earn with Uber. Learn more about the Zipcar for Uber program here .

title: Can damage protection be applied to only certain drivers under a business account?
body: Damage protection cannot be applied to individual drivers on business accounts. It can only be applied for all or no drivers on the account. You can learn more about updating your protection plan coverage here.

title: Where can I find the Zipcar membership contract?
body: The Zipcar membership contract can be found here .

title: Do drivers joining my account pay any fees (membership, application)?
body: No, account fees (such as membership and application fees) are charged to the payment method associated with the account the drivers are joining. The type of fee or amount to be charged depends on your membership plan and any sponsorship you may have. You can review all fees charged to your account by following the steps below: Sign in to your Zipcar account Click on Billing in the top navigation menu Review all transactions posted to your account Keep In Mind Some transactions, like tolls, violations, & citations may come in several weeks following a driver's trip

title: Can I create, cancel, or modify bookings of drivers on my account?
body: Yes, account admins and owners are able to create, cancel, or modify the bookings of any driver on their business account. To create a booking for a driver on your account, select a car for their trip on the Book tab , choose the driver from the drop-down menu, and complete your reservation. To cancel or modify a driver’s booking, select the driver from the drop-down menu in the Trips tab and update the necessary booking as needed. Keep In Mind This book on behalf of feature is not available in the Zipcar app. Account admins & owners can view all upcoming, ongoing, and past trips of their drivers .

title: Can I see upcoming, ongoing, or completed trips of drivers on my account?
body: Yes, account admins and owners can see all upcoming, ongoing, and completed trips of drivers on their account Sign in to your Zipcar account Click on Trips in the top navigation menu Review all booking & trip activity of drivers on your account Keep In Mind Account admins & owners are currently unable to manage or modify the bookings of drivers on their account

title: Who is responsible for the charges & fees on my account?
body: Account & trip fees (including membership and application fees) are charged to the payment method associated with the account the drivers are joining. The type of fee or amount to be charged depends on your membership plan and any sponsorship you may have. You can review all fees charged to your account by following the steps below: Sign in to your Zipcar account Click on Billing in the top navigation menu Review all transactions posted to your account Keep In Mind Some transactions, like tolls, violations, & citations may come in several weeks following a driver's trip

title: Can I export the invoices for my business account?
body: Yes, to export invoices for your business account, follow the steps below: Sign in to your Zipcar account Click on Invoices in the top navigation menu Export invoices as a CSV or PDF

title: How can I bring Zipcar to my campus?
body: If you would like to bring Zipcar to your college or university, fill out the form on our university page . Once submitted, our Zipcar for Universit ies Team will be in touch.

title: How can I opt out of the sharing or sale of my personal information?
body: You can opt out of the sharing or the sale of your personal information by following the below steps: Sign in to your account Select Do Not Sell My Info at the bottom of the page Confirm your selection

title: Are service animals allowed for members with disabilities?
body: For members with service animals, we waive the requirement that pets should be in carriers. We do ask that you help care for our vehicles and ensure pet hair and odors are cleaned from the car at the end of your trip.

title: Is driving credit on my account available to all drivers on my account?
body: Yes, driving credit is used towards the cost of a booking prior to any card payment and is available to all drivers on your account. Any leftover credit will remain on your account until it is used or expires.

title: How can I update the name of my business?
body: The business name on file cannot be changed online. Please reach out to us at business@zipcar.com so we can assist you with your request.

title: How can I view current and past invoices or statements for my business account?
body: If you pay on a monthly basis, current and past invoices for an account can be viewed by following the steps below: Sign in to your Zipcar account Click on Invoices in the top navigation menu Each invoice other than the current invoice will have a payment status next to it (paid or unpaid) and can be viewed as a CSV or PDF document. If you pay by credit card, individual transactions for your account can be viewed by following the steps below: Sign in to your Zipcar account Click on Billing in the top navigation menu Select individual trips or transactions to view more details To export transaction activity over a period of time, select Download Activity and input a date range.

title: Can I export my transaction history?
body: Yes, to export all transactions on your account, follow the steps below: Sign in to your Zipcar account Click on Billing in the top navigation menu Select Download Activity Input date ranges and download results

title: How can I learn more about my unique Zipcar mobility needs for my larger business?
body: If you require a m ore custom Zipcar solution for your business, fill out the form on our enterprise page . Once submitted, our Zipcar Enterprise Solutions Team will be in touch.

title: Can I require drivers on my business account to input a booking memo?
body: As an owner or admin of an account, you can require all drivers to input a booking memo, or note, by following the steps below: Sign in to your Zipcar account Click on My Account at the top of the page and select Account Settings Select the Trip Memos card Select Memos required on all bookings Click Update to save your settings

title: How do I drive as a business admin?
body: To add driving privileges to an admin account, follow the steps below: Sign in to your Zipcar account Click on My Account at the top of the page and select Account Settings Select the People tab and search for the member's name Click the overflow menu (3 vertical dots) to the right of the member name Click Update role Select Driver as well as Admin You will be able to see the updated role change reflected on the account member list on the people page. Keep In Mind Only owners & admins of a business account can add driving privileges to an admin account

title: How can I search the drivers who are on my account?
body: To search the drivers on your account, follow the steps below: Sign in to your Zipcar account Click on My Account at the top of the page and select Account Settings Select the People tab Scroll to the bottom of the page to view a list of members on your account Alternatively, on the People tab you can search for an account member by entering their name or email address into the search bubble just above the member list

title: How can I bring Zipcar to my residential property?
body: If you require a more custom Zipcar solution for your business, fill out the form on our residential services page . Once submitted, our Zipcar for Residential Properties Team will be in touch.

title: Am I able to switch my current membership plan to a promotional plan?
body: If you already have a Zipcar account with a standard membership plan and would like to change to one that is sponsored by a business or organization you are associated with, please contact us for assistance. Be sure to provide the name of the sponsoring organization and our support team will find the best available plan for you.

title: Why do I have an authorization, pending charge or hold on my credit or debit card?
body: When a Zipcar reservation, membership application, or account fee has been charged to the card on file, your bank may show the charge as pending or on hold. This is your bank's way of setting aside the spent funds while it prepares to transfer the funds out of your account. Once the funds have been fully transferred from your bank, the pending charge or hold will be removed. This process can take up to 3 - 5 business days, but will vary by banking institution.

title: Why is my pending charge or authorization more than my purchase?
body: Typically, banks will set aside recent charges to your credit or debit card as a hold or pending authorization. However, some banking institutions may set aside additional funds or holds as it processes the transactions. Once the funds have been fully transferred from your bank, the pending charges or holds will be removed. This process can take up to 3 - 5 business days, but will vary by banking institution.

title: Why do I have multiple holds or authorizations on my credit card?
body: Typically, banks will set aside recent charges to your credit or debit card as a hold or pending authorization. Multiple pending charges, authorizations, or holds on your credit or debit card may appear if your Zipcar booking is modified. For example, extensions to your trip, purchases of additional insurance products, and other changes may result in additional holds or authorizations on your card. Once the funds have been fully transferred from your bank, the pending charges or holds will be removed. This process can take up to 3 - 5 business days, but will vary by banking institution.

title: How do I manually grant location access to the Zipcar app?
body: Before being able to unlock your car with the mobile app, there are some features that need to be enabled and some permissions that will have to be granted. Usually, we'll ask that you turn on these features and allow these permissions when you first use the app. If you're still having some challenges unlocking your Zipcar, check here for more troubleshooting tips. Apple iOS Go to your Settings app Find or search for Zipcar Under Location be sure it's set to While Using the App and Precise Location is enabled Bluetooth should be enabled Cellular Data should also be enabled as a fallback if Bluetooth doesn't work Google Android Open your Settings Go to the Apps section Under All Apps either find or search for Zipcar Select Permissions Select Location, tap Allow only while using the app and Use precise location is toggled on Need more help? iOS users can go here for more information from Apple Android users can go here for more information from Google

title: Why does it say invalid when I enter my email to create a Zipcar account?
body: All email addresses that are not associated with a past Zipcar account and tied to a valid email platform should be accepted. Please ensure your email is typed correctly. For example, it should reflect name@domain.com Tip Are you still having trouble? Hit the contact us button to get in touch.

title: Why can I not submit my Zipcar application?
body: If you are trying to submit your application and are encountering an error, please try the following troubleshooting tips: Confirm the payment card being used is activated Confirm there are sufficient funds available on the payment card Note: Some merchants may authorize an additional pending charge to the account If the payment method you are using has tried to be authorized 5 times or more in the course of adding your payment method, then your card may be blocked. Please reach out to your banking institution to confirm the card has not been blocked Tip Are you still having trouble? Hit the contact us button to get in touch.

title: What account security measures does Zipcar take?
body: At Zipcar, we take your safety and security very seriously. A Zipcar representative will never ask you for the following information: Complete payment card numbers Your password Two-factor authentication codes Any information that is not relevant to your Zipcar account If you receive calls, notifications, or emails from sources you are unfamiliar with regarding your Zipcar account, feel free to contact us directly by selecting Contact Us at the top of the page, or calling our customer support team. Note Zipcar does not offer any paid advertising incentives or opportunities for vehicle branding and is likely the actions of fraudulent actors

title: Why can I not submit my selfie and/or driver license photo?
body: If you are having issues taking or submitting your selfie or driver's license, ensure the following is correct. All submitted photos must be clear; blurry or obstructed photos may delay your application Consider reviewing our eligibility requirements for driver's license requirements, if an ineligible driver's license is detected it will not be accepted If using a mobile device, please ensure you have given permission to take photos from the Zipcar app or mobile browser Tip Are you still having trouble? Hit the contact us button to get in touch.

title: Why am I having trouble applying for a promotional membership?
body: If you are trying to apply for a promotional membership and are encountering an error, please try the following troubleshooting tips: Please use the promotional membership join link provided by the sponsor, if the join link is not working, please contact the sponsor of the membership If you are entering another promotion code at the checkout it may void the promotional membership, please do not enter another promotional code at the checkout Tip Are you still having trouble? Hit the contact us button to get in touch.

title: Why am I having trouble applying for a University membership?
body: If you are trying to apply for a university membership and are encountering an error, please try the following troubleshooting tips: If you have signed up with your university email address under a traditional account please contact us so we can help correct your account Please check your spam and junk folders for the verification email, emails may take a few hours to reach your inbox. Please contact your university if no email is received Tip Are you still having trouble? Hit the contact us button to get in touch.

title: Why am I having trouble applying for a Business membership?
body: If you are trying to apply for a business membership and are encountering an error, please try the following troubleshooting tips: Please check your spam and junk folders for an email from Zipcar with your invitation link sent by your business owner or administrator If no email has been received in over 24 hours, please contact your business owner or administrator. Tip Are you still having trouble? Hit the contact us button to get in touch.

title: What is the refer-a-friend promotion?
body: If you're looking to join Zipcar or have a friend that would like to join, our refer a friend promo allows existing members to refer a new member. Both the current and new member will receive $25 in driving credit after the new member has been approved. Click here to begin referring your friends to join Zipcar today. Keep In Mind This offer is limited to 10 rewards per member The terms and conditions of the offer can be found here

title: Why was I moved from a Student Plan to an Alumni Plan?
body: Student memberships are provided through University Partners. Student memberships with Zipcar may be valid for up to 6 years. After your student membership has expired you will be moved to Zipcar’s standard alumni plan. Note If you are still in school and were moved, please contact us so we may assist your further and review your student eligibility

title: Why do you ask for end trip photos?
body: The photo upload feature provides you with a quick way to report the condition you left the vehicle in. By doing so, it helps ensure that you’re not held responsible for a damage or mess that occurred outside of your trip window. In addition to protecting you from damage claims, end trip photos help the Zipcar team ensure any vehicle issues are addressed promptly so we can keep good members like you coming back to clean, well maintained cars.

title: I received an unknown charge, how can I tell if this is from Zipcar?
body: While we try our best to ensure the charges you incur are correctly labeled on your billing statements, sometimes there are bank limitations that may prevent a clear description of charges. If you see an unclear message on your credit card statement, such as “ MAY-I-Z-29599477-33 ” or “ JUL25 #14947870 ”. It might be your recurring charges ( e.g., membership fee, damage waiver, etc. ) or delayed trip charges ( e.g., violations ). Any charges will be reflected via your Zipcar account billing page or by email. If you have been charged and are not seeing any related billing activity please contact us by submitting a request so we may assist you.

title: Why are check-in photos important?
body: The photo upload feature provides you with a quick way to report the condition of the vehicle when your reservation begins. By doing so, it helps ensure that you’re not held responsible for a damage or mess that occurred outside of your trip window. In addition to protecting you from damage claims, photos help the Zipcar team ensure any vehicle issues are addressed promptly so we can keep good members like you coming back to clean, well maintained cars.

title: I am a business member, how can I open a personal account?
body: Business members can have secondary personal accounts with Zipcar. Application fees are typically waived when opening secondary accounts. To open a secondary account, log in to your Zipcar account and follow the steps below. Navigate to your account settings and select view plans and pricing . Select the membership type that meets your needs - you can choose an annual or monthly personal plan . Follow the prompts to enter your driver's license information, personal details, and payment information (all membership & trip fees will be charged to this payment method) After your driving application is approved, you can reserve and drive cars on your personal account . Keep In Mind To toggle between your personal and business account, select the My Account at the top right-hand side of your screen. A drop-down menu will appear with your business name and your name. The business name is your business account, and your name is your personal account.

title: I have a business account, how do I join my family's personal account?
body: Business members can also have personal accounts to drive with Zipcar. Application fees are typically waived when opening personal accounts. The family account holder will need to invite you via your business email You will receive an invitation link to join the family account. Click through the invitation link to sign into your account. After signing in, your account will reflect the family plan immediately. If you are not a driver on the business account, you must enter your driver's license to apply to drive. Your application to drive will be submitted after you confirm your license information. After your driving application is approved, you can reserve and drive cars on your family account. Keep In Mind To toggle between your personal and business account, select the My Account at the top right-hand side of your screen. A drop-down menu will appear with your business name and your name. The business name is your business account, and your name is your personal account.

title: How do I contact Zipcar?
body: We want to provide you with the best support possible and there are a number of ways you can seek answers and reach us. Help Center You can search the Zipcar Help Center 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. Here you will find answers to the most commonly asked questions as well as a wealth of information related to all things Zipcar. You can search the Help Center by clicking here or from within the mobile app by clicking Account and selecting Help Center . Phone Support If you need help immediately, you can reach us on 866-4ZIPCAR (1-866-494-7227) and speak with an agent. If you are using the mobile app you can click on Account and select Call Zipcar . For those in an active reservation, phone support is available 24 hours a day, otherwise phone support is available from 8 am - 11 pm ET, 7 days a week. Chat You can reach our chat support option in the Zipcar app by clicking Account and scrolling down and selecting Chat or from our Help Center by clicking on the widget at the bottom right of the page. You will be greeted by our helpful chatbot who will assist you instantly. If your query is not resolved, and you need further help, you will have the option to be connected with a support agent. Chat support is available from 8 am - 11 pm ET, 7 days a week. Social Media You can send us a direct message on our social media accounts on Facebook , Twitter and Instagram and you will be connected with an agent who can assist you with your query. Support is available from 8 am - 11 pm ET, 7 days a week. Submit A Support Ticket Click here to open a support ticket from the Help Center or select Contact Us at the top of this page to get in touch. Be sure to provide a clear explanation of your request, including images if relevant. Please note it can take 2 - 3 business days to receive a response.

title: I changed my membership plan, how will I be charged?
body: When you change your membership plan, you'll be shown the date the new plan will take effect and how much you'll be charged. You are charged this new rate only when the new plan kicks in. If you change your plan within 30 days of your account becoming approved or reactivated, your changes happen immediately. You'll receive a refund for your previous membership fee and be charged for your new membership fee.

title: Does Zipcar have electric vehicles in its fleet?
body: Yes, Zipcar has begun to introduce electric vehicles into limited markets as part of an electrification pilot. Our members in these markets will have access to EVs as we collect feedback to help us successfully rollout more across our cities. To learn more about how to use our EV’s, visit our EV Guide or Help Center .

title: What is a "Daily rate only" booking?
body: Some vehicles have a daily rate booking only option, meaning there is no hourly rate available. These vehicles are great for longer bookings and you can book them for as long as you'd like. Keep in mind that each 24-hour period is charged at a single daily rate. For example, if you book for 36 hours, you will be charged 2x the daily rates. Remember, our daily rates may vary by day. Also, please note that you only have the car for the number of hours you book. So, if you book a car for 8 hours, the car will be subject to a late fee if you return it after that amount of time. You can find these vehicles by looking for the blue label. Tip Book your car for a bit longer than you may need within a 24-hour period, just in case, since your rate won't change.

title: How do I change my membership plan?
body: If you want to change your membership plan from monthly to annual, annual to monthly, or a university membership, you may do so by accessing your account settings on Zipcar.com. Go to your Account Settings page Click Your membership , then click Manage Plan to modify your membership You will then have the option to select a new membership plan Note: If you select a university membership, you will need to verify your student email address. Once you select the plan, you will be shown when the new plan will begin and the amount that will be billed Once submitted, you'll get a confirmation pop up Keep In Mind Membership plans can only be switched to monthly, annual, or university plans. If you want to switch to a promotional membership please contact us .

title: What are pay-by-plate tolls and how do they work?
body: Zipcar now uses the pay-by-plate method to calculate toll charges. When you drive through a toll lane, a camera captures your license plate and the toll is billed to your account. You’ll typically see the charge on your invoice within 2–3 weeks. As of January 2024, the Delaware River Joint Toll Bridge Commission expanded pay-by-plate service to seven of its older toll bridges, which previously accepted only E-ZPass or cash. If you approach a toll plaza with only E-ZPass or cash lanes, simply drive through the E-ZPass lane. You’ll still be charged using the pay-by-plate method. Keep In Mind The New York City congestion toll features a unique discounted rate available to Zipcar members under a specific agreement with New York City. This rate may differ from the amounts displayed while traveling through the area. For more details on our current congestion toll rates, please refer to the article: Why was a congestion charge toll added to my reservation?

title: Can I use my own toll pass in a Zipcar?
body: We do not recommend using your own Toll Pass in Zipcars since tolls are calculated by the Zipcar license plate and are non-refundable. This ensures you will not receive two charges for the tolls and will just receive the single toll charge in your Zipcar invoice.

title: How do I start my EV trip?
body: Start your EV trip like any other Zipcar by using the app. Unlock the car, then do the damage and cleanliness report. Your location will be a Charging Home Location or Non-Charging Home Location. If it’s a Charging Home Location , there is a charging station at the Zipcar home parking spot, and you will need to unplug the charging cable from the car to begin your trip. If it’s a Non-Charging Home Location , there is no charging station at the Zipcar home parking spot, and you do not need to unplug. Here's How to Unplug: After starting your trip, remove the charging cable by pressing the button on top of the cable and pulling (this may require a little bit of force). Return the cable to the charging station and remember to close the charging door on the car. Hop in and push the EV’s start button. Press the brake and turn the gear dial or buttons on the shifter to put it in Reverse or Drive. Look at the dashboard to see your range—that’s how far you can drive until you need to find a charging station to juice up. Keep In Mind: Check what type of home location your EV is parked in by looking at the location details in your reservation. Driving ranges are an estimate and may vary based on a variety of factors, including, but not limited to, driving conditions, driving habits and weather. Cold weather, fast driving, and using the AC or heat will slightly reduce your range.

title: How do I end my EV trip?
body: Returning an EV is the same as any other Zipcar, except you must plug the car in before ending your trip if it's parked at a Charging Home Location . Here’s the details: Return your car to the same location you picked it up from. Your location will be a Charging Home Location or Non-Charging Home Location . If it’s a Charging Home Location , there is a charging station at the Zipcar home parking spot, and you will need to plug the car in at the end of your trip. If it’s a Non-Charging Home Location , there is no charging station at the Zipcar home parking spot, and you do not need to plug the car in at the end of your trip. Here’s how to plug your car in and end your trip: Park in a spot with an EV charging station. You’ll need to keep the car unlocked to access the charging port. So don’t lock up or end the trip quite yet! Grab the charging card from the visor and follow the directions on the charging station to plug in. Once your car’s plugged in, return the charging card to the visor. You’ll know the car is charging when the red charge icon in the dashboard lights up. Once it does, you can clean up and take all your stuff with you. Then lock the doors and end the trip in the app. Quick Tip Check what type of home location your EV is parked in by looking at the location details in your reservation.

title: How can I find a charging station during my trip?
body: Use the Plugshare app (or website) or Google Maps to find one along your route. Filter for charging stations with Level 2 (J-1772) or Level 3 (CCS/SAE) connectors and the same brand as the car’s charging card, or existing accounts you have. Some things to keep in mind: Level 3 (CCS/SAE) charging stations are much faster but harder to find. They’re often found along highways. 80% of charging stations are Level 2 (J-1772). Plan on spending at least 1-2 hours to get a decent charge. The charging card in the EV is brand specific—it only works at charging stations with the same brand or their partners. You can charge at any station, but you’ll have to submit receipts for reimbursement if it’s a different brand from the EV’s charging card. Charging takes time. So make sure your reservation is long enough to recharge and drive back to the car’s home location. You can extend in the app or via SMS. Keep In Mind Charging times are an estimate and may vary based on a variety of factors, including, but not limited to, vehicle model, driving conditions, driving habits and weather.

title: How do I use the charging card?
body: Each charging station is different, but you can count on a few things: You’ll need a charging card for the Chargepoint or SemaConnect brands. You might need to download their apps for the station—Flo or EVgo. You can’t pay with cash or your credit card like at the gas station. Each charging station has instructions on the station or onscreen. The charging station will let you know if the car’s charging. And the red charge icon in the car’s dashboard will also turn green. Some stations may ask you to pay for parking. We don’t reimburse for parking during a trip. A Level 2 charger takes about an hour to add 30 miles or 10% of battery life in a Kia Niro. * When you lock the car, the charging cable locks into the port. It will keep charging, even if you walk away. If you get an error, don’t panic. Try repeating the last step or starting over. Remember to return the charging card to the visor or cup holder. You’ll need it to plug in the car when you return. Keep In Mind Charging times are an estimate and may vary based on a variety of factors, including, but not limited to, vehicle model, driving conditions, driving habits and weather.

title: What happens if I run out of charge?
body: Don’t worry! Your EV will give you an estimate of how many miles you have left throughout your trip. It changes depending on how fast you drive, the outdoor temperature and whether the heat or AC is on. You can recharge any time, but if you’re below 10% look for a charging station ASAP. Unlike gas cars, there’s no reserve tank. Once the charge level hits zero, the EV will stop running. So don’t risk it. If your battery runs out, call us at 866-4Zipcar and wait until roadside service gets there to tow the EV to the closest charging station. This could add 2–3 hours to your trip on top of the cost of the tow. If you need help finding a charging station download the Plugshare app or use Google maps or Plugshare online to find the closest location.

title: Can I take a long trip in an EV?
body: Yes! But you should plan ahead for charging. Make sure you know: The difference between Level 2 and Level 3 charging The type of charging stations along your route (Use an app like Plugshare or Google Maps to plot your trip.) What brand of charging card is in the EV You can use brands that are not compatible with our charging card, but make sure to download their app and set up an account to make the actual charging experience more seamless. And remember to add enough time in your reservation to charge if you plan to take a long trip.

title: What does Zipcar expect from me during my EV trip?
body: EV trips have the same rules as all our cars: Be back on time. Clean up before you go. Plug-in at the end of your trip to charge it for the next member. And remember - while you don’t need to return the EV at a minimum charge, don’t press your luck. When the battery gets to zero, the car will stop and you’ll need to be towed to a charging station.

title: What is the minimum charge I must return the EV with?
body: Right now, there’s no minimum charge you need to return with since it will recharge as soon as you plug in at the home location. EVs can’t run on fumes (0% means 0%), so we suggest leaving at least 15% of charge for your return trip in case you hit traffic or make unexpected stops. Plus, that helps make sure the car’s charged for the next member, too.

title: Do you reimburse for charging costs?
body: All EVs come with a charging card you can use to recharge the battery. The charging card will work at the home location and other charging stations with the same brand. What we reimburse: The charging costs if you pay to use a different brand of charging station during your reservation Some brands use a wallet-based system with a minimum setup charge. We’ll reimburse that amount, plus the charging fees. What we don’t reimburse: The cost of the time to charge during a reservation. When booking, please plan to charge the EV if you’ll be driving more than 40-50 miles. Parking costs at a charging station during a reservation.

title: What is regenerative braking?
body: Kia Niro's have paddles on the steering wheel that control the regenerative braking feature. When it’s set to HIGH, the car will slow down more quickly when you take your foot off the gas. And it uses the resistance of braking to produce a small amount of electricity to recharge the battery. If you prefer smoother braking, use the paddles to tune the braking to LOW .

title: What if the charging card is missing from the visor?
body: Don’t worry, we’re here for you. If you notice the charging card is missing at the start of your trip, contact us immediately, and we’ll find another car for you. If you don’t notice it’s missing until you’re already on the road, contact us when you return to the car’s home location, so we can help you end the trip correctly. Remember, without a charging card, you won’t be able to plug in your EV at the home location.

title: Where can I use the charging card?
body: Most of our EVs come with Chargepoint charging cards that work at any Chargepoint charging station. When you use this card, it will bill us directly. Plugging in at a different station? Just submit your receipt — including date, time and amount — and we’ll reimburse you. Use the Plugshare app (or website) or Google Maps to charging stations on your route. Look for stations that are compatible with J-1772 or CCS/SAE connectors. Most Level 2 or Level 3 charging stations that are not Tesla branded should work for your car. Level 2 Stations – AC charging (J-1772 connectors) and make up 80% of public chargers. Level 3 Stations – DC charging (CCS connectors) and charge much faster.

title: How do I charge my EV?
body: Just follow these steps: Plug in your EV at the charging station. Follow the on-screen instructions. Check the base of the windshield for three green lights to indicate it’s charging. If there are no green lights, double-check to make sure that you didn’t miss any steps while charging, which may include pressing a start button or tapping the charging card against the station.

title: Where’s the charging door and how do I open it?
body: On the Kia Niro, the charging door is on the front, near the headlights. On the Chevrolet Bolt, the charging door is on the side. Gently press the charging port door to open it. If it doesn’t open, make sure the vehicle is unlocked, as the charging door automatically locks when the vehicle is locked.

title: How do I unplug the charging cable?
body: First, follow the on-screen instructions at the station to stop the charging process. Then, unlock your vehicle, which allows you to remove the charging cable from the vehicle’s charging port. Remember to press the button on the cable to release it and plug it back into the charging station when you’re done.

title: What if I can't plug in the car at the end of my trip?
body: First, check that you turned the EV off and the doors are unlocked. Do not end your trip yet. Then, gently press the charging port door near the headlights to open it. When you’re plugging in, make sure the charging cable is correctly aligned with the port holes. If the charging station is giving you an error, try tapping your charging card again. That usually fixes it. After plugging in and returning the charging card to the visor, end your trip. If your trip screen is no longer active in your Zipcar app or if you’ve ended your trip, reach out to us for help.

title: What if the designated Zipcar EV parking space is taken?
body: Don’t worry, just park in any available Zipcar spot at that location and contact us. Having trouble figuring out which spot is yours? It’s in the Zipcar app on the My Trips tab under View Details . You can also check your booking confirmation email. Your Zipcar app is also great for other troubleshooting tips, including what to do if the parking garage is closed, an entry parking pass is missing, or if you're having an issue with the valet parking.

title: What if the charging cable is stuck?
body: Sometimes the charging cable can be a little tricky. Make sure that: You’ve stopped charging. You’ve unlocked the EV. You’re pressing the release button on the charging cable. If this still doesn’t work, try pulling the cable a little harder.

title: How far can I go in an EV?
body: When determining an EV’s range – weather, speed, AC/heater use and other factors can all contribute to battery levels. To be on the safe side, here’s what to expect per 25% of charge*: 50 miles in normal conditions 40 miles when it’s below freezing * Driving ranges and charging estimates are estimates and may vary based on a variety of factors, including, but not limited to, vehicle model, driving conditions, driving habits and weather. See the chart below for driving estimate ranges per charging level. Charge % Level Distance to empty (miles)** **Driving ranges are an estimate and vary based on a variety of factors, including, but not limited to, vehicle model, driving conditions, driving habits and weather. Estimates based on the 2022 Kia Niro in cold and mild weather. Cold Weather (20ºF and lower) Mild Weather 100% 165 miles 212 miles 75% 123 miles 159 miles 50% 82 miles 106 miles 25% 41 miles 53 miles

title: Why do charging stations have "6.5 kW" or "50 kW" as part of their description?
body: kW measures the amount of electric flow through a charging connection. It’s also how to determine if a charging station is Level 2 or Level 3. Level 2 stations range from 6.5kW to 19.2kW. Level 3 stations are anything higher than 19.2kW—with the most common wattage being 50kW. The higher the kW, the faster your EV will charge.

title: How can I find and book an EV?
body: It’s easy. In the Zipcar app, just search by “Car Type” and select “Electric”. Or simply look for the lightning bolt next to cars in your area!

title: How fast do EVs charge?
body: How fast an EV charges depends on the type of charger it’s plugged into. There are two types of chargers: Level 2 and Level 3. The higher the kilowatts on the charger, the faster the car will charge. Level 2 chargers (6.5 kW – 19.2kW) – A 7.2 kW charger can add up to around 18 miles of range per hour*. Level 3 chargers (50 kW and above) – These chargers can add about up to around 135 miles of range per hour*. While Level 3 charging stations are much faster, they are harder to find. You can usually locate them near highways. *Charging times are an estimate and may vary based on a variety of factors, including, but not limited to, vehicle model, driving conditions, driving habits and weather. Use the Plugshare app or Google Maps to find charging stations along your route. See the chart below to learn more about each type of charger and how quickly they will charge an EV. Level 2 (Ac Charging) Level 3 (DC Charging) Overview Most common charging stations Fast charging stations Kilowatts / Power Range 6.5kW - 19.2kW 50kW and greater Plug Type AC Connector: Type 1 – J1772 DC Connector: CCS Combo 1 Vehicle Charging Port Some Benchmark Estimates* *Charging times and expected driving ranges are estimates and may vary based on a variety of factors, including, but not limited to, vehicle model, driving conditions and habits, weather, and charging station. Power Rating 7.2 kW 50 kW 30 min of Charge 9 miles 68 miles 45 min of Charge 14 miles 101 miles 60 min of Charge 18 miles 135 miles

title: How do I pause my membership?
body: We know that sometimes you need to take a break and hit pause on your Zipcar membership rather than cancelling it altogether. And that's A-OK with us! You can pause your monthly membership for up to three months, allowing you to take a breather without saying goodbye. So go ahead and hit that pause button - we'll be here when you're ready to get back on the road! To pause your monthly membership: Log in to your Zipcar account on the website or mobile app Go to My Account and click on your membership plan Click Cancel Membership , and you'll be prompted to pause your membership for up to three months Pick the timeframe for the pause period that works for you Click Pause Membership and you're all set Your membership will be paused during the selected period and you won't be charged for any usage. When the pause period ends, your membership will automatically reactivate, and you can start using Zipcar again. Keep In Mind Annual memberships are unable to be paused Damage protection that is cancelled or charged in the pause period is non-refundable If you have a monthly damage protection plan, it will also be paused unless you choose to cancel it If you purchased an annual damage protection plan and decide to pause your membership, it will be cancelled Additional trip costs, such as tolls and violations from past trips, will be charged if received during the pause period A paused membership can be reactivated on your account page Any trips previously booked during the pause period will be cancelled

title: Can I opt out of facial recognition during the application verification?
body: Applicants with a Texas or Illinois driver's license, or applying in markets in either state, can opt out of facial recognition during the application process. It's easy to do – check the box that says "Opt-out of facial recognition" at the end of the verification section when applying to join Zipcar. By opting out, your application will be manually reviewed, which may take up to 3 business days. So, no worries if it takes a bit longer; we'll still make sure to process your application. We hope to see you on the road soon!

title: What type of gas should I put in my Zipcar?
body: You may have to fill up your Zipcar while driving, so knowing what fuel to put in is important. The majority of our cars should be filled with Regular Unleaded/87 Octane gasoline. Our luxury class vehicles, such as Mercedes and BMWs, should be filled with Premium Unleaded/91-94 Octane gasoline. You should never put diesel into any of our cars as this can cause severe and permanent damage to the engine. Diesel nozzles can usually be identified by their green color. Keep In Mind You should always return your Zipcar with at least 1/4 gas.

title: How can I request my Zipcar account be deleted?
body: Did You Know? You can pause your monthly membership for up to three months or cancel your membership entirely rather than deleting your account. For more information, check out this article . Account deletion can be a significant decision, and we're here to guide you through the process. Below you will find step-by-step instructions on submitting an account deletion request. Android & iOS Log in to your Zipcar account on the mobile app Go to My Account and select Privacy and Legal Click Delete account Confirm you would like to delete your account or cancel your membership Review the terms of requesting account deletion, acknowledge the request, and click Delete account Web Browser UK Members If you are a member in the UK, please see this article for information on processing account deletion requests. Open the deletion request page You can then choose to cancel your membership or delete your account Review the terms of requesting account deletion, acknowledge the request, and click Delete account Keep In Mind Once your account deletion request has been submitted, you can no longer access your Zipcar account Account deletion requests can only be requested if you are not in an active Zipcar trip To reverse your account deletion request, please refer to: I requested to delete my account — can I undo it? Any future trips will be cancelled and refunded automatically after submitting a deletion request

title: How can I update my phone number if I no longer have access to the original number?
body: Are you experiencing issues with your Zipcar account because of a lost or changed phone number? We've got your back. To regain access and update your phone number, let's verify your identity. Email us at account-recovery@zipcar.com with these details: Emailing us from your current Zipcar account email Your past phone number on your Zipcar account The new phone number you want to use Explain the issue preventing login or phone number update Snap a clear photo of your driver's license (matching your account) Take a picture holding your license (showing your face and the license) If your license address differs, send a matching document (utility bill, etc.)

title: What are Zipcar's current promotions?
body: Zipcar regularly offers discounted booking promotions to eligible members. Discounts can be applied at checkout by selecting available promotions or inputting a unique promotional code received. More information on how to redeem booking promotions can be found here . Active driving promotions and their Terms & Conditions can be found below. January Midweekday Promo: Valid on reservations 4 hours or longer that take place on Tuesdays, Wednesdays or Thursdays between 1/20/26 at 12:00 a.m. EST and 2/5/26 at 11:59 p.m. EST. Reservations must end no later than 11:59p.m. EST on 2/5/26. Reservations on Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays, or Mondays, and any reservation that begins before 1/20/26 or ends after 2/5/26, will not qualify for any discount, and the entire reservation will be billed at regular rates. Valid for hourly and daily rates and has no cash value. Promo cannot be combined with Zipcar rewards or any other offer. Zipcar may change or revoke the discount any time. $20 Off Because We Miss You: Promotion is valid for select members on reservations booked within 21 days. Valid for daily or hourly rates only and has no cash value. $9 Off Welcome Back: Promotion is valid for select members on reservations booked within 30 days. Valid for daily or hourly rates only and has no cash value. $25 Off Your Next Ride when you renew: Promo valid only for recipients of this email. Must be redeemed at checkout within 30 days of issue date. Valid for daily or hourly rates only and has no cash value. Zipcar may change or revoke the discount at any time. Promo cannot be combined with Zipcar rewards or any other offer.

title: Can I use Apple or Google Pay?
body: Google and Apple Pay can be used for the initial reservation but not for membership fees, post-booking trip charges, or trip-related expenses such as tolls. A default card must be on file for these costs. Ensure Google or Apple Pay is set up on your device to use it for booking. Mobile App Instructions While on the Zipcar mobile app, once you have selected your desired reservation details (including any per-trip protection or liability insurance ) proceed to the Payment section and tap on your current payment method to make changes. On the next screen, select Google Pay or Apple Pay. If Google Pay or Apple Pay does not appear as an option, it means the Google Pay or Apple Pay wallet has not been set up on your phone. Once you have selected Google Pay or Apple Pay, click done to return to the checkout. Once you return to checkout, scroll to the bottom of the page to pay with Google Pay or Apple Pay and complete your booking.

title: Why was a congestion charge toll added to my reservation?
body: As of January 5, 2025, New York City has implemented a congestion charge within the designated congestion zone. Zipcar members and drivers will be subject to this charge, which is based on either off-peak or peak pricing. Peak periods for the congestion zone are weekdays 5AM - 9PM and weekends 9AM - 9PM with a toll rate of $9.00 . A toll rate of $2.25 will be in effect during off peak hours. Keep In Mind Congestion prices and peak periods are subject to change. More information can be found here .

title: I was in an accident. What should I expect during the accident process?
body: We understand that being in an accident can be stressful and overwhelming. To help provide some clarity, here’s how our accident process works: Complete the Accident Report: After you report the accident, we’ll send you an accident report via text message that must be filled out and submitted. While we wait for your completed report, your Zipcar account will remain suspended. Once we receive your report, we will review your account and update you on the status of your suspension within 3 business days. Zipcar Reviews Damage and Liability Claims: Our teams will assess and review any damage or liability claims related to the incident. This process can take several weeks. While we gather and review the necessary information, you may not hear from us right away, but rest assured, we are actively working on your case. We will follow up with you as soon as we reach the next step in the process. Billing Follow-up: Once all claims and damage assessments are complete, we will reach out to you to discuss any applicable damage fees or third-party claims and finalize the billing details. Here are some things to know or keep in mind as we process the accident report: Account Status: Your Zipcar account will be suspended while we await your incident report. Once we receive your report, we will review your account and provide an update on your suspension within 3 business days. Vehicle Inspection: Zipcar will assess the vehicle for any damage and arrange for necessary repairs. Damage Fees: If there is no breach of contract, can be up to $2500; if a waiver was purchased, your damage fee may be less. For more information on damage fees, please refer to Is there a damage fee if I damage a Zipcar vehicle? Liability Provider: Zipcar’s claims administrator, Sedgwick CMS, handles our liability claims. You can reach them at 866-345-2474 for assistance

title: How do I undo my account deletion request?
body: If you requested to delete your Zipcar account, you have 30 days from the request date to reverse this decision. How to undo your account deletion request Locate the deletion confirmation email sent to you on the date you requested to delete your account In the email, scroll to the bottom and select Undo deletion Confirm your decision by selecting Restore Now A success message will appear, confirming that your account has been restored

title: What is the Zipcar Rewards program and how does it work?
body: What is the Zipcar Rewards program, and how does it work? Zipcar Rewards is a program in which our standard membership has been pre-enrolled to earn discounts on future trips. For eligible consumer members, every $250 spent on eligible bookings—including driving rates and mileage but excluding taxes, tolls, ancillary fees, late returns, and violations—you’ll receive $5 in rewards. Eligible university members have a student rate of $5 in rewards for every $200 spent. Who qualifies for the Zipcar Rewards program? Zipcar Rewards is currently available to eligible consumer and university members. If you're eligible for the program, you'll see a Rewards tab in your account overview or on the Zipcar App navigation bar Can I still earn rewards when I use a reward on a trip? Yes, if your trip cost is more than the reward redemption you may be able to earn rewards on a trip in which you use a reward. In example, if your trip cost is $50 before taxes and fees and you redeem $45 in rewards you would earn $5 spend toward your next reward. Which charges count toward earning Zipcar Rewards? Only driving rates and mileage charges count toward earning Zipcar Rewards. Other fees and charges do not qualify. Rewards will not be earned for trips that violate community rules—such as returning late, leaving low fuel, or not maintaining interior cleanliness. What are the terms and conditions of the Zipcar Rewards program? For full details, please visit our Terms and Conditions page . Can I combine my rewards with other promotions or discounts? At this time, rewards cannot be combined with promotions or discounts that require a promo code at checkout. Do my rewards ever expire? Redeemed Rewards: Once you redeem a reward, it must be used within 30 days. Earned Rewards: Your reward balance expires 12 months after your most recently earned reward. For example, if you earned $5 in February and another $5 in March, the full $10 expires in March of the following year. If you earn more later, your expiration date extends accordingly. Rewards Progress: If you don’t take a trip for 12 months, your progress toward earning rewards will reset. Taking at least one trip a year keeps your progress active. Where can I check my rewards balance and available offers? You can check your reward balance on the Mobile App or Website. To check your rewards in the Zipcar mobile app: Open the app and sign in to your account. You'll see a Rewards tab at the bottom of the screen. Tap it to view details about your rewards, including pending, earned, and redeemed amounts. To check your rewards on the Zipcar website: Log in to your account and look for the small Rewards icon next to your account icon in the top right corner of the homepage. Click it to view your pending, earned, and redeemed rewards. To check your rewards on the Zipcar mobile website: Sign in to your account and tap the menu icon in the top-left corner of the screen. A menu will pop up, and you’ll see the Rewards option, where you can view any available rewards. How do I use or redeem my Zipcar rewards? You can redeem your Zipcar rewards either from your Rewards page or during checkout. To redeem at checkout: Select “Add Promo or reward” during the checkout process. Your available dollar-off reward will appear—select “Redeem.” A confirmation prompt will appear. Select “Redeem and Apply” to use the reward for your booking. If you've already redeemed the reward, simply choose “Apply” to add the discount to your reservation. You’ll see confirmation that the reward has been applied on the Promotions and Rewards page. Click “Done” to return to checkout and complete your booking. To redeem on your Rewards page: On your Rewards page, click the "Redeem" button next to your total earned rewards. A prompt will appear asking if you'd like to redeem your rewards and proceed with booking by selecting “Redeem & Book”. You’ll be directed to the search page to choose a car and time that best fits your needs. Your rewards will be automatically applied at checkout, so there's nothing you need to do—just book and enjoy the savings. Keep In Mind Please update your Zipcar app to the latest version to check your eligibility for our program.

title: How I obtain a Zipcar for Uber rideshare permit & emblem to complete rider pickups at MSP airport?
body: Rideshare drivers who wish to pickup or dropoff passengers at Minneapolis-St Paul International Airport (MSP) must obtain a permit and display an emblem. Failure to do so will result in a fine levied against the driver. Obtaining A Permit Go to tncpermit.mspmac.org Fill out the MSP Airport permit form online—you will need to have your social security number & vehicle VIN Ensure your driver’s license is current and all documents are up-to-date At Your Permit Appointment Show your driver's license Verify that you are an active user on your app Show a copy of your current vehicle inspection (see attachments below) A permit fee of $25 per TNC will be charged by debit or credit card (cash will not be accepted) Verify and sign a copy of the form you submitted Airport staff will verify your information and provide you a decal for each vehicle as well as a paper driver's permit After Your Permit Appointment Apply the decal to your windshield. MAC ordinance requires the decal to be affixed on the middle of your windshield behind your rearview mirror.  Apply it so you easily remove it from the vehicle when your trip is complete! Carry your paper driver’s permit with you or upload a photo of the permit to your app (if applicable) under “MSP Airport Permit” Remove the decal from the windshield upon completion of your Zipcar for Uber trip

title: What is the Zipcar Membership Beta?
body: We’re introducing a new membership beta program to give members more flexibility and perks . In addition to our Standard plan, select members can now choose from two new plans: Lite ($5/month) or Plus ($19/month) . What is the Membership Beta? The Membership Beta allows select members to join one of our new plans: Lite or Plus . These plans are designed to fit different driving needs—whether you drive occasionally or often. Lite : Best for local, occasional trips. Monthly only offering . Standard : Our always-on membership offering, with options for monthly or annual memberships . Plus : Perfect for frequent drivers looking for extra value and perks. Monthly only offering . If you are an existing Zipcar member , you’ll see the new plans available when managing your plan in the Membership section of your Account Settings . What do I get with the Lite and Plus plans? Lite ($5/month) 50 miles/day included Gas & secondary insurance included Cancellation requires 24 hr. advance notice No additional drivers Plus ($19/month) 300 miles/day included Gas & secondary insurance included 15-minute early access to trips $10 monthly driving credit (expires each month) 1 additional driver included + up to 2 more at 50% off Flexible trip cancellation (same-day for trips under 8 hours, 24 hours for longer trips) Can I change plans during the beta? Yes! Members can self-service plan changes through their Zipcar account. Upgrading : When moving to a higher plan (Lite → Plus), the amount you already paid for the lower plan will be prorated toward your upgrade. Downgrading : When moving to a lower plan (Plus → Lite), the change will take effect at the next billing cycle . Can I stay on my current Standard plan? Absolutely. If you’re happy with your Standard plan , no action is needed. You can switch to Lite or Plus anytime during the beta if you want to explore the new benefits. How do I add extra drivers? Lite plan members cannot add any additional drivers to their account. Standard members can add up to 1 additional driver at 50% off the monthly membership cost. Plus plan members can add up to 3 additional drivers to their account. The first driver will be at no additional membership cost, the second and third drivers will be at 50% off the month membership plan cost. How does the $10 monthly driving credit work on Plus? We’ll add your $10 driving credit to your account on the first day of your billing cycle. You can use it on any reservation, as long as the trip is booked within the 30-day window—even if the reservation occurs later. What are the mileage overage rates? Mileage over age rates are the same across all plan options: $.67 per mile over the amount included with your membership plan. Will there be an annual option ? Currently, Lite and Plus are monthly-only plans. Annual memberships are not yet available for these tiers.

title: Which Payment Methods are Accepted?
body: Zipcar accepts major credit and debit cards (Visa, Mastercard, American Express, Discover). You may also use Apple Pay or Google Pay for the initial reservation, however, you must have a default credit or debit card on file for all other fees; including membership fees, tolls, and other trip-related expenses. At this time, Zipcar does not accept prepaid cards of any kind, re-loadable or not. Zipcar also does not support buy now, pay later options such as Klarna or Affirm.
